José Francisco is 27 years old and married.  He lives with his son and his wife, and they are his greatest priority.  He intends to use the loan to buy fertilizers and other products that he needs for his crops to develop well.  He will also pay for labor to help with the crops.  The  workers will weed the fields manually in order to avoid using chemicals.  They will also do some agricultural work like establish levels to avoid soil erosion caused primarily by the rain.  This way he assures himself of doing good work.

He intends to take advantage of the good weather and soil conditions for this crop.  He will also put into practice his many years of experience in the management of basic grains.  He will also be able to buy the best products and the best quality products.  He will do this so that his fields develop well, are healthy, and have an adequate short term production.

He will use the income from the harvest that he hopes to get for the well-being and education of his family.  He will also meet some family goals and continue investing more in the crops.

This is the first loan he has received from FUDECOSUR.  He has not had any other previous loans with state banks.  FUDESCOSUR gave him the loan with better terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other products and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en: Regina is 38 years old and lives in the area of Airport, Liberia. She’s married and has six children between the ages of 12 to 22. Two are attending school and they all live at home. Her husband is a businessman, For the past 20 years Regina has owned a bakery business. She enjoys baking, because she makes a lot of profit. The profits are to support her children and buy food for  her home. Regina is requesting a loan to purchase more flour, sugar, oil, and etc. for her business. She hopes to build a house for her children and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more flour, sugar, oil, and etc. for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of phone cases, chargers etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy cooking utensils, and food ingredients like grains, wheat flour, cooking oil etc.

loans.name: Mamie

texts.en: Mamie is 39 years old ,married and live in Airport, Liberia with her three children, all of whom live at home. Two are attending school. Her husband is a contractor.  For the past 10 years she has been involved in business and currently she sells palm oil. She walks to reach the village to buy palm oil for her business,since neither car nor bike can reach the village. She enjoy the flow of customers, and the support she can give to her family. She has learned this way of selling from her mother. She is requesting a loan to purchase more palm oil for her business. Her plan is to educate her children and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil for her business

loans.name: Nghiem

texts.en:
Nghiem was born in 1960. She has two children. The older one is a worker. The younger one is studying in an university. Her husband and she have a farm where they raise poultry, fish, and tortoises and grow fruit trees. She gains from it 4,000,000 VND a month. Her family’s total earnings are about 15,000,000 VND per month. 
She has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2011. In the last cycle she borrowed 5,014,000 VND and repaid the loan on time. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 6,322,000 VND to buy crocodile breeds to raise and for selling. Then she wants to use her profit to buy more fish breeds and tortoise breeds.

loans.use: to buy crocodile breeds to raise and sell.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 56 years old, married and has four children.  She runs a green grocery to earn a living.  She also does farming for extra income.  She has employed one person in the business.  Through Faulu Kenya, she has learned how save her money.  This is thanks to Faulu Kenya training her on financial management.
Mary hopes to expand her business in the future.  She has requested for a loan of 20, 000 KES to buy potatoes and green peas.

loans.use: To buy potatoes and green peas

loans.name: Sara Delia

texts.es:
Estelí el diamante de las Segovia de esta linda ciudad es originaria la señora Sara Delia, una mujer muy esforzada.

Actualmente es trabajadora de una empresa desempeñándose como supervisora. solicita a ceprodel un crédito, lo necesita para comprar una lavadora; el cual le va ser de mucha importancia ya que le va facilitar y agilizar el lavado de la ropa de su familia.
texts.en:
Esteli is the diamond of Segovia. From this lovely city originate Sara Delia, a very valiant woman.

Currently, she is a worker in a company serving as a supervisor. She is applying to Ceprodel for a loan. She needs it to buy a washing machine, which will be very important to her since it will facilitate and expedite her family’s laundry.

loans.use: to buy a washing machine.

loans.name: Kuasha

texts.en:
Kuasha, age 27, is single and lives in a rental house in the town of Msambweni.  Through his own effort he has managed to establish a small store in his house. He sells beans, rice, eggs, flour, soft drinks, cookies, sugar, etc. He also does farming where he plants various crops like pawpaw and bananas.

He has requested a loan for 30,000 KES in order to stock the business. He will buy a greater quantity of merchandise and basic food products.

Kuasha hopes to own a bigger shop in future.

loans.use: buy a greater quantity of merchandise and basic food products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy additional stock of coconut oil, perfumes and other chemicals.

loans.name: Bakari

texts.en:
Bakari is 42 years old; he is accompanied by Mesalim and they have two children, both of whom attend school.

Bakari is in sales. He has a small grocery store which is well stocked. It's been about one year since he got into this business, so he has a good customer base and a little experience in the industry. He started with capital that he had saved from the sale of farm produce. He is still in farming and that adds income to support his family. He grows a variety of crops on his farm which he visits during the evening.

He's requesting this loan to buy basic necessity items to stock his store, such as foodstuffs, drinks, and dairy products, among other things. He appreciates the confidence and the opportunity to get ahead that he's received, and he says that he won't disappoint.

loans.use: to stock his store with foodstuffs, drinks, and dairy products, among other things.

loans.name: Duyen

texts.en:
Duyen was born in 1979. She has two children who are at primary school. Her husband and she have been carpenters for six years. Duyen makes 5,000,000 VND a month from her job. Her family’s total earnings are about 10,000,000 VND per month. 
She has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2008. In the last cycle she borrowed 7,630,000 VND and repaid the loan on time. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 8,938,000 VND to buy a wood saw machine. Her dream is to keep her children going to school till higher education and buy a computer for them.

loans.use: to buy a wood saw machine.

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en: Pacita, 44 years old, is a married entrepreneur from Militar, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur with four children and is earning a living from her transport business. It has been in existence for almost four years now and she earns 4,000 PHP a month. To improve her business, she is borrowing the amount of 3,000 PHP from GDMPC micro-credit which she joined in 2008 to obtain accessories and tires. Before long, she’s hopeful of the possibility of expanding her business.

loans.use: to obtain accessories and tires

loans.name: Nowai

texts.en: Nowai is 49 years old and she she lives in Airport, Liberia. She did not go to school, is married, and has nine children between 16 to 31 years old. Three are living with her and going to school. For the past 15 years she has been selling slippers in the local market. A problem that she faces is a goods shortage since she doesn't have a storage location. She likes her business because it provide for her needs and helps her support her children. Her husband work in the security field. She requesting a loan to purchase fashion slippers to expand her business. Her plans are to educate her children and build her house.

loans.use: to purchase fashion slippers to expand her business

loans.name: Ana Malia

texts.en: Ana is 51 years old and married with 8 children. She wants to start a small business making and selling ice-cakes in her community. To do this, she needs a loan to buy a fridge, sugar, plastic bags, barrow, Kool-aid, and foam cups. In the future, Ana hopes to continue her business to earn money for her family meet their daily needs. She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to pay for a fridge, sugar, plastic bags, barrow, Kool-aid, and foam cups.

loans.name: Nazario

texts.en: Nazario represents the future of farming in his village. He wants to continue the family tradition while concurrently implementing new and innovative technologies in order to remain competitive. Using his 6-cubic-meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester, he will be able to reduce his energy and fertilizer costs while improving yields. Using waste from his cows, pigs, and sheep, Nazario will be able to displace and hopefully eliminate firewood and non-renewable LP gas use onsite. Additionally, the resulting potent organic fertilizer will increase yields in his maize, squash, bean, and oatmeal crops. This loan represents 51% of the total cost of his Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.use: To purchase a 6-cubic-meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is from Katipunan, Plaridel. She is 47 years old, married, and has four children. 

To make a living, Lolita owns and operates a nipa hut manufacturing business. Lolita has engaged in her business for three years and earns PHP 4,000 a month for these activities. Recently, Lolita joined GDMPC. 

Lolita is requesting a loan of PHP 5,000 that will be used to purchase nipa huts and to pay for the labor cost in nipa making. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials to manufacture new nipa huts and to pay for the labor cost.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en: Ruth is 27 years old and live in Airport, Liberia with her husband and three children. All of her children are in school and between 6 and 8 years old. For four years she has been selling uniforms, clothing, etc in the market. She was taught by her aunt how to sell and started this business with money given to her by her aunt. She continues to make more profit and gain more customers. She is asking for a loan to buy more uniforms, clothing, etc for her business. Her plans are to expand her business even more.

loans.use: to buy more uniforms, clothing, etc for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more stationery goods such as photocopy paper, books, pens, envelopes etc.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther, 40,  is a hard-working mother of five who has been managing her food business for the past three years. She lives at Compound #3  with her husband and children, who are between the  ages of 4 and 25. Two of the children stay with her at home and are in  school while the other three live outside the home and are independent. Esther sells palm oil and rice in the community market. She makes a profit when she sells. With the profit  generated from the business, she buys  more  goods and attends to the needs of her children. She is requesting a loan to purchase more palm oil and bags of rice to sell retail. Her plan for the future is to give her children a better education.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil and bags of rice to sell retail.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 43 years old, married and has four children. She practices dairy farming to earn a living. Previously, she ran a cafeteria. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has managed to grow her business. This has helped her to venture into pig and poultry farming.

Mary hopes to own rental houses in the future. She has requested a loan for 50,000 Kenya shillings to buy a dairy cow.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Maria Elsa

texts.es: La señora María vive en la zona de Villa armonía, es viuda y tiene un hijo con el que vive en la casa de los padres de ella. María sigue con la misma actividad que es la venta de cosméticos y productos de belleza los cuales sigue repartiendo a crédito a varios clientes de la zona y otros lugares de la zona central, cuenta que le fue muy bien con la actividad y se siente agradecida con los prestamistas de kiva ya que esta creciendo en su negocio, en esta ocacion solicita el credito para la compra de cosmeticos por mayor y que se encuentran en promocion ya que de esta manera generara mas utilidades.
texts.en:
Maria lives in the zone of Villa Armonia. She is a widow and has a son with whom she lives in the house of her parents. Maria continues with the same work, which is the sale of cosmetics and beauty products, which she continues distributing on credit to various customers of the area and elsewhere in the central zone. She says that this work went very well for her and she is thankful to the lenders at Kiva since her business is growing. 

On this occasion, she is applying for the loan to buy cosmetics wholesale and that are on sale since in this way she will generate more profits.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics wholesale.

loans.name: Sunita

texts.en:
Sunita is 31 years old .  She is married and has two children aged 12 and 7.  In 2000, she established  her grocery store business.  Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, she supports her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid 5 loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent to buy grocery goods for her business.  

In the future, Sunita plans to uplift the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support. 

In the Kathmandu Valley, the small grocery store, called 'pasal', is an important part of the local economy.  Fresh produce, milk, and staples such as rice, lentils, and flour are purchased daily for cooking in the home.  Owners of small grocery stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profit margins.  By keeping inventory strong and purchasing in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase profitability.  While a typical 'pasal' might be no more than 100 sq. feet, they are always full of bargaining customers, incoming produce, and shrewd businesswomen.

loans.use: to buy grocery goods

loans.name: Mwanampikao

texts.en:
Mwanampikao sells fruits and vegetables. She is widowed and has three children, all of whom are in school. She has been selling fruits and vegetables for over ten years years.

Currently, she needs to invest in fresh fruits and vegetables like tomatoes, potatoes, peppers, apples, papayas and other fruits and vegetables that are necessary to continue selling. This loan will help strengthen her business and help so she can have the security to continue the business.

Mwanampikao's hope is to be able to educate her children, which will allow them to have better opportunities for advancement. With the business, she also hopes to maintain adequate sales and income to cover living expenses.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables like tomatoes, potatoes, peppers, apples, papayas and other fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Siatta

texts.en: Siatta is 43 years old and lives in Gardnersville with her husband and six children. For the past 14 years, she been operating a shop where she sells bags of cement. One problem she faces is the poor road condition to her shop that affects her income. She wants to open another shop in the marketplace. She says her business has brought her respect. She is proud today that her family depends on her for support since she is the most successful one in her family. She is requesting a loan to purchase huge quantities of cement for her business. Her plans are to see her children finish high school and to establish another shop.

loans.use: to purchase huge quantities of cement for her business.

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en: Hawa is 49 years old and lives in Airport. She is married with nine children between 25 to 38, all of whom live on their own. For the past 10 years, she been selling cosmetics, soap, etc. in the market. She started this business with money given to her by her husband and learned this way of selling from her mother. She is appreciative of her business because of the money she earns. She is requesting a loan to purchase more cosmetics, soap, etc. for her business. Her plan is to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more cosmetics, soap, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Letty

texts.en:
Letty works hard to support her family. Letty is widow and has a buy and sell charcoal and rice business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for eight years now, and also earns additional income from farming rice.

Letty requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of charcoal and rice to sell. In the future, Letty would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal and rice to sell

loans.name: Ponciana

texts.en:
Ponciana works hard to support her family. Ponciana is married and has a blacksmith business in the Philippines.  She requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy materials for her blacksmith business.

Ponciana has been in this business for 15 years now.  In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

Ponciana is shown in the accompanying picture with her finished products - machetes with wooden handles and wooden sheath to protect the user.

loans.use: buy materials for her blacksmith business

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is a hardworking entrepreneur, who has a general store and buying and selling vegetables business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell in her general store and vegetable vending business. Lorna has been in this business for five years. 

Lorna has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell.

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.en:
Vicenta is 60 years old and married with five children. She works very hard to provide for them.
Vicenta runs a general store in the Philippines and is requesting a PHP 21,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks to sell.
Vicenta has been in this business for seven years and sells a variety of items such as soft drinks, eggs, noodles, and canned goods.
In the future, Vicenta would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks to sell

loans.name: Ma. Nita

texts.en:
Ma. Nita is 44 years old, married with five children. Three of her children are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Ma. Nita has a fishing business in the Philippines. Ma. Nita has requested a PHP 11000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fishing nets and other equipment. Ma. Nita has been in this business for 6 years. In the future, Ma. Nita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and other equipment.

loans.name: Zaldy

texts.en: Zaldy works hard to support his family. Zaldy is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines. He requested a PHP 19,500 loan through NWTF to buy additional fishing equipment for his fishing business. Zaldy has been in this business for 15 years now. In the future, he would like to save enough to provide a secure future for his family.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing equipment for his fishing business

loans.name: Rose Marie

texts.en:
Rose Marie is married with 6 children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Rose Marie is 43 years old and has 3 children who are currently in school.

Rose Marie has a hollow-blocks-making business in the Philippines. Rose Marie requested a PHP 18000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional materials for her business. Rose Marie has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, Rose Marie would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials for her business

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is 45 years old, married with six children. Four of her children are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Aida has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Aida has requested a loan of PHP 12000 through NWTF to buy more fish to sell.

Aida has been in this business for six years. In the future, Aida would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Marselinus

texts.en:
Marselinus aged 40 is a married man. He is blessed with two children: Marianus,16, is attending senior high school grade 1 and Sesilia,11, is attending elementary school grade 6.

Marselinus owns a business selling coconut and gasoline. He has been involved in the business since 2010. In order to generate more income, Marselinus recently started selling coconut ice. He operates the business from 9 a.m. to 7 p.m.and is assisted by his wife and his children.

Marselinus wants to enhance his business by selling mung bean porridge. He believes that the more food he sells, the more income he earns.  To implement his dream, Marselinus is proposing a loan from TLM amounting to IDR 3,000,000. He wants to use the loan to build a cart and to purchase a stove, cooking pot, glasses, and cooking ingredients.

loans.use: to build a food cart and to purchase a stove, cooking pot, glasses, and cooking ingredients.

loans.name: Siah

texts.en: Siah is 32 years old and lives in the Air Port area with her husband and two children that are in school, aged 11 and 14 years old. For six years now, she has been involved with local soap-making in the market. Her mother taught her how to make local soap and sell it. She makes a lot of profit since she is the only one who makes and sells local soap in her community. She is requesting a loan to buy more caustic and oil for her soap-making. Her plan is to expand her business and build herself a house.

loans.use: to buy more caustic and oil for her business making local soap

loans.name: María Petra

texts.en:
María Petra, the matriarch of a farming household in a small town in Tlaxcala, knows the importance of staying competitive. Their farm represents their primary income source and María Petra has decided to invest in a 6 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester because she hopes to reduce energy and fertilizer costs, thereby freeing up money for other things. 

With the waste from her cows, pigs, and chickens, she will be able to produce biogas for use in the kitchen and bathroom, displacing firewood and non-renewable LP gas. The treated waste will be a potent organic fertilizer for use on her corn plot. This loan represents 51% of the total cost of her Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.use: To purchase a 6 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester

loans.name: Mauring

texts.en:
Mauring is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business selling recycled materials in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell in her recycled materials sales business.

Mauring has been in this business for 11 years. Mauring earns additional income from meat vending, buying and selling charcoal, and raising pigs.

Mauring has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell.

loans.name: Felixberta

texts.en:
Felixberta works hard to support her family. She is married and has an abaca weaving business in the Philippines.

Felixberta has requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy materials needed for her abaca weaving business.

She has been in this business for three years.

In the future, Felixberta would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her abaca weaving business.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria works hard to support eight children. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Gloria requested a PHP 1,650 loan through NWTF to buy a solar lamp.

She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to have backup light in case of emergency.

Gloria is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to purchase a solar lamp

loans.name: Orias

texts.en:
Orias, 49, is a father of four children. Yuniati, 13, attends 1st grade of senior high school; Yesika, 11, attends 5th grade of elementary school; Yopatra, 9, attends 3rd grade of elementary students and Yoblens, 3, is not in school. 

To make a living, Orias has been breeding pigs. He has been engaged with the business for years and has stable customers. Orias usually raises the pigs for at least six months and resells them. In order to expand the business, Orias wants to operate a cattle-fattening business. Therefore, he is requesting a loan from TLM amounting to IDR 8.000.000 to purchase two calves.

loans.use: to purchase two calves.

loans.name: Ma.lora

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Ma Lora works hard to support her family.

She has an internet cafe business in the Philippines and earns additional income from food vending. Ma Lora is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to buy an additional unit and computer supplies for her internet cafe business.

Ma Lora has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy an additional computer and computer supplies.

loans.name: Janilyn

texts.en:
Janilyn is 54 years old and a widow, with two children.

Janilyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 27,000 PHP loan through NWTF, to buy additional stock like noodles, soap, can goods, snack foods, etc..

Janilyn has borrowed and repaid 22 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 19 years and also earns income from selling fruits and farming coconut.

Janilyn aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stock like noodles, soap, can goods, snack foods, etc.

loans.name: Ramon

texts.en:
Ramon is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business selling distilled water in the Philippines. He is borrowing 29,500 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to purchase additional gallons of water to sell.

Ramon has been in this business for five years and he also earns additional income from buying and selling wood. He has been sustaining his business activities through his own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. Ramon dreams of saving enough money so he can afford to send his children to college.

loans.use: to purchase distilled water to sell.

loans.name: Rizel

texts.en:
Rizel works hard to support her family. Rizel is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Rizel has been in this business for 30 years now.

Rizel requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy fish to sell.

In the future, Rizel would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Sherlene

texts.en:
Sherlene is 32 years old and married with four children.

Sherlene works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks like can goods, sugar, soft drinks, milk, spices, etc..

Sherlene has borrowed and paid 14 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from pig fattening and fishing.

Sherlene aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock like can goods, sugar, soft drinks, milk, spices, etc.

loans.name: Michelle

texts.en:
Michelle is 34 years old and married, with four children.

Michelle works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a loan of 18,000 PHP through NWTF, to buy more items like snack foods, soft drinks, egg, soap, spices, etc..

Michelle has borrowed and repaid 20 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns income from fish vending. Michelle aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more items like snack foods, soft drinks, egg, soap, spices, etc.

loans.name: Mario

texts.en:
Mario, originally from Brazil, works full time as a cook in a Brazilian restaurant but has always been passionate about journalism. Mario noticed that the Brazilian community had limited access to information and news in their own language, so he decided to create Manchete USA, an online newspaper available in Brazilian Portuguese. 

The website features news from Brazil, the world, U.S. politics, immigration issues and updates, sports and news about the Brazilian Community in the U.S. Mario loves his work, but he really enjoys watching his community engage with his articles. 

For Mario, the biggest challenge for Manchete USA is getting the world out about a young newspaper. This is why he is currently working on branding his business to attract more readers, more advertising and more website traffic. One of his tactics has been to gather local restaurants and businesses as sponsors to  support the newspaper by offering coupons on his website. 

Mario is asking for a loan to purchase a new computer, a professional camera and a new printer. These items will help him accommodate the new demand that will come from his campaign. His goal is to keep working to build a successful business that will serve as an example for his daughter and son. Help Mario grow his business and give the Brazilian community access to news and information from their country and the rest of the world.

loans.use: to buy a new computer, a professional camera and a printer

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
Nelly is 47 years old and married with one child in school. Nelly works very hard to provide for them.

Nelly runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like can goods, soft drinks, noodles, egg, etc..

Nelly has been in this business for five years. 

In the future Nelly would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like can goods, soft drinks, noodles, egg, etc.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 41 years old and married with three children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Marilyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks of noodles, spices, sugar, soap, shampoo, etc. to sell.

Marilyn has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as soap, sugar, can goods, soft drinks, etc.

In the future Marilyn would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock of noodles, spices, sugar, soap, shampoo, etc. to sell

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma is 72 years old and a widow with five children.

Thelma works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 20,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell.

Thelma has borrowed and repaid 18 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for six years and also earns an income from rice retailing.

Thelma aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell.

loans.name: Danilo

texts.en:
Danilo works hard to support his family. Danilo is married and has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines.

Danilo requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of his motorcycle.

Danilo has been in this business for 26 years now.

In the future, Danilo would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle

loans.name: Acosta Ñu Group

texts.es:
El comité Acosta Ñu tiene 21 integrantes  en donde todas tienen una pequeña actividad en la cual trabajan y gracias a la cual dan a sus familias todo lo que necesitan para salir adelante. Están creciendo y gracias a las capacitaciones están mejorando.
Trifina, la presidenta, cuenta que tiene una despensa bien surtida, con todo tipo de productos de primera necesidad, con lo cual abastece a su barrio. Se define a ella misma como una persona que desea salir adelante, y que por ello se esfuerza, y que lo esta consiguiendo.
Solicita de este préstamo para poder invertirlo en productos de primera necesidad, como ser leche, huevo, verduras, fideos, arroz, azúcar, panificados y demás, ya que con esto tendrá surtido su negocio y podrá trabajar al máximo como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
The Acosta Ñu committee has twenty-one members.  Each one has a small business, thanks to which their families have all they need to get ahead.  They are growing and thanks to their training they are improving.

Trifina, the president, tells us she has a well-stocked grocery from which she supplies her neighborhood with all kinds of basic needs items.  She describes herself as a person who wants to get ahead, so she makes an effort and is succeeding.  

Trifina is seeking this loan to invest in basic necessity items like milk, eggs, vegetables, noodles, rice, baked goods, etc., because then her grocery store will be stocked up and she can work to the max as she always has.

loans.use: to buy milk, eggs, vegetables, noodles, rice, sugar, baked goods, etc.

loans.name: Erman

texts.en:
Erman is the owner of West Net Online LLC, an online retailer and re-seller. The business has been operating for over 11 months and mostly focuses on the online re-sale of books. The books can be easily purchased online and are shipped to the buyer. 

Additionally, Erman, taking advantage of his strong knowledge and skills with electronics, recently started to repair and recycle phones, iPads and other electronics as an added service. This new idea has been very successful for his business. He buys broken electronics and refurbishes them for resale on the online market. 

Since the biggest challenge for starting the business has been the lack of cash flow, Erman is requesting a loan that would help him buy new inventory so he can increase his product selection and grow his business. Erman’s dream is to become a successful CEO and to be able to place his company in the Inc. 500 List of Fastest Growing Companies.

loans.use: to obtain more inventory for his online book resale business and broken electronics repair service

loans.name: Alina

texts.en:
Alina is originally from Cuba and came to Miami ten years ago. Six months ago, she became partner with her cousin Jose, also from Cuba, when they took the opportunity to purchase a self-service laundry. The business has coin operated washers and dryers and is located in a busy strip mall which includes a supermarket, restaurants and clothing stores. 

Both Alina and Jose are strongly committed to growing the business. Alina works during the day, while Jose attends to his full time job. Then Jose comes in to cover the night shifts.  Since they bought the business, they have been making small improvements and offer additional services, such as selling phone cards, to increase income. 

Their next goal is to increase clientele and to diversify products and services offered. Support Alina and Jose in this new stage as small business owners with a loan that will help them continue to make small renovations and updates to equipment, attracting more people to the business.

loans.use: to make small renovations and update their equipment

loans.name: Batzaya

texts.en: Mrs.Batzaya is 34 years old and lives with her husband and four children in a Ger (a Mongolian yurt), in the Dornogovi province of Mongolia. Her husband, Ganhulug, is 33 years old and is a senior security guard in a private company. Her three children go to the local secondary school. In 2008, she started her portable retail stall at the railway station. She is retired from a felt producing company where she was involved in an industry accident and lost 4 fingers. She is planning to rent a permanent place to operate grocery store at railway station. She is requesting 1,000,000 MNT loan to cover her newly-starting permanent business location expenses. She is a diligent, hardworking and responsible woman.

loans.use: To cover her newly starting permanent business expenses

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en: Elisa is from Sepac, Sapang Dalaga. She is 34 years old. She is separated and has two children. To make a living, Elisa has cultivated bananas to sell for 4 years and earns 12,000 PHP a month for these activities. In 2010, Elisa joined GDMPC. Elisa is requesting a loan of 25,000 PHP which will be used to pay for services to increase banana production. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

loans.use: to pay for services to increase banana production

loans.name: 3 De Junio Group

texts.es:
Este comité es un grupo muy activo,  y a pesar de tener algunos inconvenientes siempre supieron salir adelante. El grupo se encuentra en el ciclo 7º , y gracias a su trabajo ya tiene un buen ahorro.
La Sra. Laura es la tesorera del grupo , y siempre sabe  llevar bien adelante su puesto ya que es muy estricta, ella tiene ventas de ropas  de todas clases y desea  que su negocio vaya creciendo y así poder más productos que poder ofrecer a sus clientes.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de prendas, con lo cual podrá seguir ganándose la vida y el sustento para su hijo.
texts.en:
This committee is a very active group and despite some challenges, they always know to get ahead. The group is in its 7th cycle, and thanks to its work, it already has some savings.

Laura is the treasurer of the group, and she always knows how to perform great, because she is very strict. She sells all kinds of clothes and wants her business to grow so she will be able to offer more products to her customers. She is requesting a loan to buy clothes, so she will be able to continue earning a living and supporting her child.

loans.use: to buy clothes for sale.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María tiene 48 años, está casada hace más de 23 años con el Sr. Juan de 50 años, tienen 2 hijos  quienes ya son  mayores de edad y gracias a sus padres ya son profesionales.
Ña María y Don Juan se casaron muy jóvenes y empezaron a trabajar en la Argentina durante muchos años, es ahí donde juntaron la plata para poder volver al país y construir  una casa propia que tanto soñaban. Ya que la Sra. Maria es hija de una costurera montaron en su propia casa un pequeño tallercito de costura donde confecciona todo tipo de ropas, hace más de 10 años y gracias a esta actividad y al esfuerzo de los dos,  los hijos están en la  universidad.
Ahora desea comprar una maquina mas que le hace falta en su taller  para ello solicita el crédito
texts.en:
María  is 48 years old and has been married for 23 years to Mr. Juan who is 50 years old. She has two grown children and thanks to them they have jobs.
María and Juan married at a very young age and began working in Argentina for many years. There they saved up to go back home and build a home they dreamed about having. Since María's mother is a dressmaker they built a small shop in their home where they make all types of clothes. After working for 10 years in this business in conjunction with their efforts they were able to get their children to attend a university.
Now, she wishes to buy a much needed sewing machine and will use the loan to purchase one.

loans.use: buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Cerro Poty Group

texts.es:
Las 12 integrantes del grupo cerro poty se están esforzando por salir adelante, desean trabajar juntas y por medio de ese trabajo poder ayudar a sus hijos y familiares, son jefas de familia, que ven en el grupo un gran apoyo.
Maria Lourdes, la presidenta, se dedica a la elaboración y venta de confites, y gracias a su amabilidad con sus clientes y el buen producto de lo que hace, es que está saliendo adelante. Su meta es seguir trabajando y creciendo para ser una gran microempresaria.
Solicita este préstamo para la compra de harina, manteca, azúcar y demás insumos para seguir haciendo y vendiendo sus confites.
texts.en:
The 12 members of the group named “Cerro Poty” are striving to move forward. They want to work together so that they can help their children and relatives. These women are the heads of their families and they see this group as a great support system.

Maria Lourdes, the group president, makes and sells sweets. Thanks to the friendly service she gives to her customers and the fine products that she makes, she has been able to get ahead. Her goal is to continue working and growing so that she can become a successful micro-entrepreneur. Maria Lourdes is requesting a loan so that she can buy flour, shortening, sugar, and other supplies so that she can continue making and selling sweets.

loans.use: to buy flour, shortening, sugar, and other supplies.

loans.name: Teodoro

texts.es:
El diamante de la Segovia Estelí, de esta linda y deseada ciudad es originario don Teodoro un señor de  buenos valores morales. Es trabajador de una empresa  desempeñandose como fontanero.

solicita a ceprodel un crédito para compra de algunos materiales de construcción tales como ladrillo, cemento y arena, estos materiales van a ser utilizado para mejoramiento de su vivienda, a si darle una mayor condición de vida as u familia
texts.en:
Teodoro is a native of this beautiful and desired city, the diamond of the Segovia Estelí (a department in the north of Nicaragua).  He is a man of good moral values.  He works for a company as a plumber.

He is requesting a loan from Ceprodel for the purchase of some construction materials such as brick, cement and sand.  These materials will be used for home improvement to give his family a better living condition.

loans.use: to improve his home with the purchase of brick, cement and sand.

loans.name: Exaltacion

texts.es: La Sra. Exaltación, tiene 30 años y dos hijos de las edades de 2 y 4 años, ella se dedica a la venta de frutas de temporada, en esta época se encuentra vendiendo plátano, pero ya llega la cosecha de mangos, fruta que compra directo del productor, en esta ocasión solicita el crédito para la compra de frutas por mayor según la temporada, la Sra. Exaltación es una cliente responsable quien trabaja con nosotros desde hace tiempo, La Sra. Exaltación  enfrenta retos en su negocio que son salir de la pobreza y  va a utilizar los beneficios para mejorar su calidad de vida y la  de su familia su  sueño para su negocio es ser una de las mejores comerciantes y crecer en su negocio para así generar más ingresos.
texts.en:
Exaltación is 30 years old and has two children who are two and four years old.  She works selling fruit that is in season.  Currently she is selling bananas, but the mango harvest is approaching and she purchases that fruit directly from the producer.  She is requesting this loan to purchase in season fruits at wholesale prices.  

Exaltación is a responsible client who has worked with Emprender for a while. She encounters challenges in her business as she tries to leave poverty, and she will use the benefits to improve her quality of life and that of her family.  Her dream for her business is to be one of the best merchants and grow her business to generate more income.

loans.use: to purchase fruit at wholesale.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
This is Fatima, 45, a resident of Payatas, Philippines. She is a widow and a mother to her children. She manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Fatima runs an “ukay-ukay” business. “Ukay” literally means to “dig out” or “hollow out” from a stack or heap of anything. In Fatima’s case, she is selling used (but not yet worn out) clothes that are usually stacked up on a table or mat. Some special items are displayed in hangers. In the Philippines, especially in urban poor communities, many people resort to buying used clothes from “ukay-ukay” stalls. These are much cheaper compared with brand new clothes sold in malls. She earns a minimum of 300 Philippine Pesos (PHP) net sales every day.
 
To help her expand the business, she is requesting a PHP 30,000 loan to buy additional used quality clothes. Customers are attracted to buy from an “ukay-ukay” stall with lots of clothes to choose from. She plans to add more pants or jeans, as well as used bags and footwear. If she can roll over the profits from this loan, she can meet the customers’ demand. Through proper management of capital and profit, she can expand her business and boost its income.

Fatima hopes to give her children a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, and it is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to buy more stock of used clothes needed in her business.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
This is Marilou, She previously accessed an 15,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 15,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Marilou hopes to be able to expand his business through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week. The fellowship group is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Vagif

texts.en:
Vagif is 46 years old, married and has two daughters. He is very smart and has a good sense of humor. He raises seasonal fruits and vegetables in his garden and sells them. His monthly income is 300 AZN and his brother helps him to raise and sell the crops. 

Raising crops has been his life's project for the last seven years. This business brings him a stable income and is his sole financial source. Vagif says that drastic climate year to year has meant especially hot summers and cold winters. Summer temperatures reach 105 degrees Fahrenheit. The main problem in the region is adequate water for irrigation and for animals. Vagif is not able to build a water channel for his crops on his own. This is quite an expensive process which requires labor and special equipment.  When he heard about water loans, he was extremely excited and applied for a 2000 AZN loan. He will use this loan to pay for special equipment to rent like a tractor for making the water channel and for workers who will dig the land.

He is a trustworthy client of AqroInvest and he paid off his two previous loans.

loans.use: to pay for special equipment to rent for building an irrigation channel and for hiring workers.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
This is Evelyn, 56, resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Januario, a driver and is a mother to her five children. Together with her husband, she manages her household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Evelyn is a micro entrepreneur that cooks and sells macapuno. Macapuno is a kind of dessert made of coconut. Aside from her macapuno business, she also makes candles for additional income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 15,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy ingredients used in making macapuno like coconut, sugar, vanilla and other ingredients. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Evelyn hopes that her business will expand soon and dreams to give her family a good life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for ingredients used in making macapuno.

loans.name: Myra

texts.en:
This is Myra. She previously accessed an 14,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase quantities of raw materials like fabric, thread and other materials needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for a 19,000 PHP loan for her to buy additional supplies of raw materials like fabric, thread and other materials needed in her dress making business. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Myra dreams of being able to give her all her children a good and high quality education and hopes to expand her business through all her hard work in her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for raw materials like fabric, thread and other materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Naima

texts.en:
This is Naima, 24, a resident of Payatas, Philippines. She is married to Jamaludin, a vendor, and is mother to their children. She, together with her husband, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Naima runs an “ukay-ukay” business. “Ukay” literally means to “dig out” or “hollow out” from a stack or heap of anything. In Naima’s case, she is selling used (but not yet worn out) clothes that are usually stacked up on a table or mat. Some special kinds are displayed on hangers. In the Philippines, especially in urban poor communities, many people resort to buying used clothes from “ukay-ukay” stalls. These are very much cheaper compared with brand new clothes sold in malls. Since Yolanda’s stall is located in an urban poor public market, her business flourishes. She earns a minimum of 300 Philippine pesos (PHP) net sales every day. 

To help her expand the business, Naima is requesting an 18,000 PHP loan to buy additional used-but-quality clothes. Customers are attracted to buy from an “ukay-ukay” stall with lots of clothes to choose from. She plans to add more pants or jeans, used bags and footwear. If she can roll the profits from this loan, she can meet the customers’ demand. Through proper management of capital and profit, she can expand her business and boost its income.

Naima hopes to give her children a good future and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and were she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for more used-but-quality clothes needed in her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for accessories and parts of cameras and for the maintenance of them.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 38 years old and married, with five children.

Josephine works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines, and she requested a 17,000 PHP loan through NWTF, to buy additional items to sell like spices, milk, sugar, can goods, egg, etc..

Josephine has borrowed and repaid 11 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for eleven years and also earns an income from raising pigs. Josephine aspires to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items like spices, milk, sugar, can goods, egg, etc.

loans.name: Sherly

texts.en:
Sherly is 48 years old and married, with four children.

Sherly works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines, and she requested a 14,000 PHP loan through NWTF, to buy additional stock to sell like egg, can goods, noodles, etc..

Sherly has borrowed and repaid 11 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 2 years, and she also earns an income from food vending. Sherly aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell like egg, can goods, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines. She works hard to support her family. She has been in this business for 16 years.

Teresa has requested a 17,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy fishing nets and other fishing equipment.

In the future, Teresa would like to save enough money to repair her family home.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and other fishing equipment.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
This is Jane, 29, a resident of Intramuros, Philippines. She is married to Jerry, a logistics worker, and a mother to her children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Jane operates a washing machine rental business. She has four washing machines. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 6,000 in sales monthly.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 8,000 loan. She will be using the loan to pay for the maintenance of her washing machines. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Jane hopes that her business will expand soon and dreams that her children will have a good life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for the maintenance of her washing machines.

loans.name: El Esfuerzo Group

texts.es:
Guillermina tiene 43 años de edad y es originaria de una población llamada Zitacuaro, un lugar lleno de historia y de tradiciones donde muy cerca se encuentra el santuario de la mariposa monarca y es unos de los principales productores a nivel nacional en cultivo de flores de noche buena. Ella es parte del grupo El Esfuerzo y dice que le pusieron ese nombre al grupo porque con mucho esfuerzo están sacando adelante a sus familias, platica que desde hace mas de 20 años ella y su esposo hicieron su propio negocio para sacar adelante a sus hijos y también dar empleo a personas, ella se dedica a la elaboración de varias piezas de madera como balaustres, cajas de madera para fruta, barandales, pasamanos, etc. Guillermina platica que está pidiendo un crédito para la compra de brocas para realizar diferentes tipos de acabados, barniz y lijas para pulir la maderas, clavos, pegamento y que comprara sus artículos en la ciudad de Toluca en tiendas especializadas de madera, también dice que la madera se la llevan hasta su casa donde hacen todas sus creaciones y que ahorita lo que más le han estado pidiendo es caja para aguacate y que ya van varios productores de este fruto le han hecho pedidos y eso por eso que están pidiendo el crédito para surtir un poco mas de madera y empezarlas hacer porque les urgen a los clientes y espera que con el crédito que está pidiendo le pueda alcanzar. Guillermina dice “espero y este pedido nos salga bien para seguir haciendo más caja por mayoreo, tengo la esperanza de salir adelante porque ahorita tengo gastos muy fuertes con uno de mis *chamacos* que  se encuentra estudiando la preparatoria y es por eso que le estoy echando  muchas ganas para ayudar a mi señor  con los gastos es por eso que me estoy echando el compromiso del crédito”. 
Las otras 14 personas se llaman Yolanda, Consuelo, María Clara, Carolina, María Isabel, Rosalinda, Guadalupe, Flor de María, María Isaura, Manuela, Aurelia, Carolina, Juan Carlos y Angelina ellos invertirán sus créditos en refacciones para un taxi, para la compra de materia prima para elaborar churros, la compra de tela, hilos, agujas para elaborar vestidos, para la compra de insumos para realizar antojitos mexicanos, para la compra de cosméticos y venderlos en pagos, para surtir tienda de abarrotes.
texts.en:
Guillermina is 43 years old and is originally from an area called Zitacuaro, an area full of history and traditions, very close to the sanctuary of the monarch butterflies and some of the principal national producers of poinsettias. She is part of the group, El Esfuerzo (The Effort), and she says that they gave the group this name because with much effort they are raising their families. She relates that more than 20 years ago she and her husband created their own business to raise their children and also to provide employment. She makes various articles of wood, such as balusters, wooden boxes for fruit, railings, handrails, etc. Guillermina says that she is applying for a loan to purchase brushes for different types of finishes, varnish and sandpaper to polish the wood, nails, and glue, and that she will buy her supplies in the city of Toluca in stores that specialize in wood. She also says that they take the wood to their house, where they make all their creations, and that now what their customers have been asking for most is boxes for avocados, and that since there are already a  number of producers of this fruit, they have placed orders, and this is why they are asking for the loan, to stock a little more wood and begin to make them, because the customers are anxious to get them, and she hopes that with the loan that they are asking for they will have enough. Guillermina says "I hope that this request goes well for us to continue making more boxes in bulk. I hope to advance because now I have very substantial expenses with one of my 'kids' who is now in high school, and this is why I am working really hard to help my husband with the expenses, and this is why I am committed to the loan.

The other 14 people in the group are Yolanda, Consuelo, Maria Clara, Carolina, Maria Isabel, Rosalinda, Guadalupe, Flor de Maria, Maria Isaura, Manuela, Aurelia, Carolina, Juan Carlos, and Angelina. They will invest their loans in repairs for a taxi, to purchase basic ingredients to make churros, to buy fabric, thread, and needles to make clothing, to purchase ingredients to make Mexican snacks, to purchase cosmetics and sell them on installment plans, and to stock a grocery store.

loans.use: to buy wood, sandpaper, brushes, nails, etc.

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
El contacto para el inicio del presente comité se dio por medio de la señora que formaba parte de otro grupo, quienes la invito a que estas mujeres también tengan su grupo, para poder trabajar juntas y ayudarse. Se encuentran en el vigésimo ciclo. La Sra. Joana es miembro de este grupo y cuenta que se dedica a la venta de bebidas de todo tipo.
Gracias a su esfuerzo y a la ayuda de su grupo esta saliendo adelante. Solicita del crédito para la compra de bebidas, y de esa forma poder seguir atendiendo a sus clientes.
texts.en:
The individual responsible for starting this existing committee was a woman who was part of another group.  She invited these women so that they could form their own group that would allow them to work together and help one another.  They are now in their 20th loan cycle.

Sra. Joana is a member of the group and says that she sells all types of beverages. Thanks to her hard work and the help of her group she is getting ahead. She is asking for the credit to purchase drinks, and to be able to continue serving her clients.

loans.use: to purchase drinks for re-sale

loans.name: Kuña Rory Group

texts.es:
Este grupo es de la Ciudad de Encarnación, es muy trabajador y emprendedor, una de las integrantes del grupo es la Sra. Catalina ella tiene 6 hijos, está casada  con el Sr. Roberto y ella se dedica hace varios años a la confección de ropas. Cuenta la Sra. Catalina que solicita el crédito para la compra de telas e insumos,  ella se encuentra  muy agradecida ya que gracias a su grupo y a las capacitaciones puede mejorar sus ingresos y ayudar a familia.
 Todas las señoras del grupo también  están muy contentas por ser parte de este grupo y así trabajar y ayudarse las unas a las otras.
texts.en: This group is from Ciudad de Encarnación and is a hardworking, enterprising group. Catalina is one of the members of the group.  She has six children with Roberto and she has been engaged in dressmaking for several years.  Catalina states that she is requesting the loan to purchase fabric and supplies.  She is very grateful because, thanks to her group and the training provided, she can increase her income and support her family.  All of the women are very happy to be part of this group, working and helping one another.

loans.use: to purchase fabric and other supplies.

loans.name: Adelina

texts.en: Adelina is a married woman from Lila, Bohol. She has six children. Her oldest child is thirty seven while the youngest is twenty two. She operates a sari-sari (variety) store business. She has been in the sari-sari store business for five years. She sells soft drinks, canned goods, noodles and coffee. She requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchased more merchandise to sell, such as canned goods, soft drinks, and noodles. Adelina would like to expand her business to invest to other ventures to meet the family's need.

loans.use: to buy merchandise like soft drinks, canned goods, and noodles

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a 56-year-old widow and has four children. 

Elizabeth is in the agricultural business, farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Elizabeth requested an 18,000 PHP loan through NWTF, to pay the sugarcane laborers' salaries.

Elizabeth has been farming sugarcane for three years, and has borrowed 21 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her various activities. In the future, Elizabeth would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to pay the sugarcane laborers' salaries.

loans.name: Lilia Sarahi

texts.es:
La joven Lilia Sarahi  de 25 años de edad es madre soltera, tiene una hija que depende de ella, vive en casa de sus suegros donde tiene un pequeño negocio de pulpería, ubicado en la colonia buena vista sur de la ciudad de San Lorenzo, al sur de Honduras.
Su negocio es una pulpería donde vende todo lo relacionado a la canasta familiar, sus ventas son de lunes a domingo, sus clientes a diario le visitan para comprar lo que nesecitan en su hogar, Lilia solicita el préstamo para la compra de maíz, plásticos, frescos, frijoles, arroz, manteca, azúcar, leche y otros productos que sus clientes le están pidiendo y son los que mueve mas en su pulpería.
Lilia con las ganancias de este préstamo ella pretende capitalizar mas su negocio y seguir adelante con su familia. 
Lilia su sueño es mejorar su negocio y que su hija siga sus estudios.
San Lorenzo, Honduras - Octubre del 2012
texts.en:
Lilia Sarahi is 25 years old and a single mother.  She has one daughter who depends on her.  She lives in her in-laws house in the Buena Vista Sur neighborhood in the city of San Lorenzo in the south of Honduras where she has a small store.  Her store sells basic household items.  It is open from Monday to Sunday and her customers visit daily to purchase what they need for their household.   

Lilia is asking for this loan to purchase corn, plastic containers, drinks, beans, rice, butter, sugar, milk, and other products that her customers are requesting and that move the most in her store.  With the income from this loan, she hopes to better capitalize her business and improve her family's life.  Lilia's dream is to improve her store and that her daughter continues to study.

loans.use: to purchase corn, plastic containers, drinks, beans, rice, butter, sugar, milk, and other products for her store.

loans.name: Nemesia

texts.en:
Nemesia is a dressmaker from Catagbacan, Loon, Bohol. She has been engaged in this business for more than 40 years now. This is the source of her income.

Nemesia wants a loan to buy more cloth, thread, needles and other items. She believes that this loan will help her in making her business successful and sustainable.

loans.use: to buy more cloth, thread, needles and other items.

loans.name: Victor Hugo

texts.es: El sr. Víctor, sigue con la actividad de confección  de chamarras vive con su esposa y un hijo, cuenta que con el anterior credito le fue muy bien con la otorgacion del credito, en esta ocacion solicita el credito para la compra de tela por rrollo e hilos para la confeccion de su chamarras,  ya esta llevando sus productos a la ciudad De oruro donde le va muy bien esta creciendo en su actividad y esta mejorando sus ingresos economicos.
texts.en: Víctor continues to make jackets.  He lives with his wife and son.  He says that his previous loan went very well.  Currently he is requesting a loan to purchase bolts of fabric and thread to make jackets.  He is bringing his products to the city of Oruro where he is doing very well.  His business is growing and his income is improving.

loans.use: to purchase bolts of fabric and thread.

loans.name: Aisha Jean

texts.en:
Aisha Jean is married with three children. Aisha Jean is 42 years old and lives in Lower Lamac, Oroquieta City.

Aisha Jean engaged in a longaniza (sausage) business to earn a living and has had this business for three years. Each month, she earns 4,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for PHP 14,900 for additional capital for her business to purchase more raw ingredients.

Aisha Jean has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, Aisha Jean hopes to expand her business someday.

loans.use: to purchase more raw ingredients for her snack vending business.

loans.name: Teodora

texts.en:
Teodora is 58 years old and lives in Toril, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is married with five children. 
Teodora has a store where she sells a variety of products such as soft drinks, cooking oil, bread, biscuits, candies, and other items. She has had this business for four years. She has requested a loan of 4,000 PHP to buy additional inventory to sell. Teodora has been a member of PMPC for two years.

loans.use: to buy additional inventory to sell.

loans.name: Narantuya

texts.en:
Narantuya is 38 years old and has worked as a taxi driver nonstop since 2005.  Her husband is running a taxi business, too. Her family consists of six members: her husband and four children,  They live in their small wooden house in the ger district, an area with no running water, minimal roads, and spotty electricity in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. 

Every day Narantuya and her husband pay twenty dollars each for the car they are using. And three years later, they will get the cars.  Before these, they got two cars from a taxi service company and sold them. 

With the money, they bought a plot of land in the remote area of the city and built their house on it.  In winter, her house loses its heat through the door and gets colder, so she needs to use a coal stove to stay warm. Coal burning is becoming the primary source of air pollution in Mongolia. So Narantuya is requesting MNT 2,000,000 loan to build a small barn where the house door meets the outside. 

By doing this, her house can reduce the heat loss, and she will burn less coal, and her family will live in a comfortable condition.

loans.use: to build a small barn where the house door meets with the outside

loans.name: Ulkar

texts.en: Ulkar is a 25-year-old married woman with two children. Ulkar and her husband have a great desire to educate their son and daughter because next year they are going to school. To make a living, Ulkar raises a garden, and she earns 200 AZN monthly with this work. Within five years of beginning farming she has been able to pay school fees for her children. Ulkar requested a loan of 1000 AZN to buy seedlings for planting this season. She is a new member of AqroInvest CU and this is her first loan. In the future, Ulkar plans to improve their house to live conveniently. Within five years of beginning farming she has been able to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy seedlings for planting

loans.name: Perlita

texts.en:
Perlita is 48 years old and lives in San Roque, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is married with four children. 

Perlita has a general store. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan to purchase stock for her general store, such as shampoo, toothpaste and other consumer products.  Perlita has been a member of PMPC for eight years.  

In the future, Perlita hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock for her general store, such as shampoo, toothpaste and other consumer products.

loans.name: Marife

texts.en:
Marife is 33 years old and lives in Dolores, Clarin. She is married with two children. Marife has a store that sells a variety of products. She has had this business for seven years. Marife requested a loan to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents, etc.

Marife has been a member of PMPC for seven years. In the future, Marife hopes to supplement her family's income.

loans.use: to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents, etc.

loans.name: Solmaz

texts.en:
Solmaz is a 56-year-old IDP (internally displaced person) woman who lives in the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement with her husband and two children. 

She is a farmer and has raised seasonal fruits and vegetables for the last 20 years. She chose this business because it is profitable and fresh crops are in high demand. People use fresh vegetables every day and consider them healthy, and many national dishes like pilau and dolma are made of vegetables. Fresh fruits are served at every family table in Azerbaijan and also make fresh punch.

Solmaz sells her crop in the central bazaar. Her monthly income is 80 AZN. Her husband actively helps her to raise her crops.

As these products are in high demand, Solmaz wants to expand her business and produce more fruits and vegetables. For this purpose, she applied for a 1,900 AZN loan. She will buy new garden tools, seeds and fertilizers as well as one milk cow. She is a trustworthy client of AqroInvest and it will be her third loan.

loans.use: to buy new garden tools, seeds, fertilizers and one milk cow.

loans.name: Chichek

texts.en:
Chichek is a 40 year old woman who is married with two sons. She is IDP. Chichek breeds cattle for meat purposes. He also has two milk cows. Her profit consists of cattle sales and selling fresh yoghurt and milk. Her husband is on a pension and helps her to run the business. 

She usually buys small calves, raises and fattens them for five to six months, and then resells them for a higher price from her place (she does not need to take her livestock to the bazaar and customers and butchers comes to her house to buy livestock) and rarely in the livestock bazaar. Her monthly income is 150 AZN.  This business is only one source of financial income in her family. Meat is in very high demand in Azerbaijan, and people use it in everyday dishes like pilau and dolma. 

Now Chichek has applied for a loan of 800 AZN to buy two cattle and fodder.

loans.use: to buy two cattle and fodder.

loans.name: Immi

texts.en:
Immi is a 21-year-old woman who raises and sells seasonal vegetables in her garden. She is an IDP and lives with her husband and one son in an IDP settlement. She usually raises tomatoes, cucumbers, potatoes, carrots, and pumpkin. Her husband is laborer, and he doesn’t have a permanent job.

People use fresh vegetables everyday and consider them healthy. Many national dishes are made of vegetables, like pilau and dolma. Fresh fruits serve every table in the Azerbaijan family and also make fresh punch. Her monthly income is 110 AZN, and this is her family's primary source of income. Her husband helps her run the business. 

She applied for 1500 AZN to purchase seeds and fertilizers to increase her monthly turnover.  Immi is a trustworthy client of AqroInvest, and she has a good client history.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Nellie

texts.en: Nellie is married with 4 children. She is 62 years old and lives in Poblacion Titay, Zamboanga, Sibugay. Nellie is a farmer and owns a rice field to earn a living. She has been doing this for 40 years. Nellie has requested a loan to purchase fertilizersc to her ricefields. In the future, Nellie hopes to expand her rice field. Nellie has been a member of PMPC for 2 years.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for her rice field

loans.name: Adil

texts.en:
Adil is a 55-year-old man who works and lives with his family in the Agsu, Azerbaijan. He has four children.  

Adil owns an electrical goods store . His monthly net profit is about US$ 150-200. 

This is the third time he's applying for a loan through AqroInvest CU. He is ready to work even harder, make sacrifices and push every once in a while to achieve his goal and become a successful entrepreneur. He needs to buy merchandise to sustain and develop his business.

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Isabel

texts.en:
Isabel is 58 years old and lives in Segatic Diot, Clarin. Isabel is widowed with eight children. 

To earn a living, Isabel has a processed food business. Isabel earns about PHP 8000 each month doing this type of work. Isabel has requested a loan to purchase additional ingredients such as flour, sugar, oil, sauce, etc.

Isabel has been a member of PMPC for 6 months.  In the future, Isabel would like to save for their daily consumption.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients such as flour, sugar, oil, sauce, etc.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana is 55 years old.  She is married and the mother of seven children.  She is from Talibon, Bohol, Philippines.

Juliana is engaged in a rice farming business together with her husband.  They grow rice and other crops in their farm lot.  In addition, Juliana runs a sari-sari or convenience store selling various goods to customers in their place in Talibon.

Juliana is requesting a loan in order to buy fertilizer for the crops and additional items to sell in her store such as noodles, soda, rice, biscuits, soap and shampoo. Through this loan, she will be able to increase her income, which is necessary to pay for their expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for the crops and additional items to sell in her store such as noodles, soda, rice, biscuits, soap and shampoo.

loans.name: Silvestra

texts.en:
Silvestra is a 47-year-old married woman and a mother of two grown-up children from Baclayon, Bohol, Philippines. She has been engaged in purchasing card business for more than 10 years now. Purchase order (PO) card are used to buy groceries and other department goods without using any money.

Silvestra is in need of additional capital for her purchasing card business. She is asking for a loan worth 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos), which will be used as additional capital for her purchasing card business. The money will be used to avail more PO cards from a certain store, and Silvestra would sell it to the people who wants to do grocery without using money. An the clients would pay her money within a certain period of time.

In the future, Silvestra wants to expand her business  in order to augment her income to meet the needs of the family.

loans.use: to be used as additional capital for her purchasing card business

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en: Elvira is married and has 4 children. She is 46 years old and lives in Magsaysay, Baliangao. She owns and operates a farm, planting & harvesting corn for sale to earn a living and she's been in this business for 5 years. Each month she earns PHP 3,000 doing this type of business. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy fertilizer. In 2011, Elvira joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. In the future, Elvira wants to make improvements of her house.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Mirahror
