texts.ru: Мирахрор житель города Истаравшан. Ему 35 лет. Он женат. У него трое детей. Жена Мирахрора домохозяйка. Сам он работает таксистом. Мирахрор развозит пассажиров по маршруту Истаравшан-Душанбе. В этой области он четыре года. Мирахрор просит кредит для ремонта автомобиля, чтобы продолжить совою деятельность.
texts.en: Mirahror lives in Istaravshan. He is 35 years old, married, and has 3 children. Mirahror's wife is a homemaker, and he himself works as a taxi driver. He drives passengers along the Istaravshan-Dushanbe route. He has been doing this for the past 4 years. Mirahror is seeking a loan to repair his vehicle so that he can continue his business.

loans.use: To repair his vehicle

loans.name: Mosaab

texts.en:
Mosaab is a 20-year-old single man. For the past two years, Mosaab has been operating a workshop repairing electrical generators, and selling spare parts. It has been a profitable project, and the only source of income to him, but also needs more support to cover the cost.

Mosaab is looking to provide his customers with better quality, so he is requesting a USD loan from FATEN in order to help him cover the cost of purchasing new repair kit. This will enable Mosaab to improve the quality of his work, and take less time in repairing the electrical generators, which will lead to customer satisfaction and improve his income. Mosaab's photo is in his workshop.

About Shariah-compliant lending:
FATEN offers loan products that are designed to serve borrowers all over Palestine, including some religiously conservative areas. A key tenet of Islam is the prohibition of interest in the lending or accepting of money. This prohibition is based on the belief that money should be seen only as a medium of exchange and that it has no value in itself. FATEN has adapted the terms of this loan to fit the cultural context by attaching a 0% interest rate to the loan. In order to cover its costs, FATEN does charge a servicing fee. The amount you see fundraising includes both the principal loan and the loan servicing fees. As with all Kiva loans, you should expect to have your funds returned to you in accordance with the repayment schedule attached to this loan. For more information on lending in the Muslim world, please visit Kiva's Muslim World Lending helptext: http://tinyurl.com/3aekx8m.

loans.use: To purchase new kit for repairing electrical generators.

loans.name: Lizeth

texts.en:
Help Lizeth become a successful woman entrepreneur! Lizeth is originally from Colombia and has been living in the U.S. for almost three years. She is the owner of LDN Technologies, a home-based company that focuses on the wholesale distribution of technology. The idea for this business has long been in Lizeth’s mind, but it wasn’t until she moved to the U.S. that she found the opportunity to start it. 

Her business sells wholesale computer parts and hardware to businesses, with a focus on Latin America. Upon receiving orders, Lizeth visits the companies where she purchases the products and takes a courier who then handles the shipment. For Lizeth, her biggest success has been being able to expand her business to other countries.
 
This loan will help Lizeth purchase more inventory for her business. Being able to buy the parts and hardware in bulk will help her to get a much more competitive price from the sellers. Lizeth’s goal as a woman and as an entrepreneur is to grow the business enough to become economically independent, enter bigger markets and become competitive in the technology distribution industry.

loans.use: to be able to buy computer parts and hardware in bulk

loans.name: Pardakhol

texts.ru: Пардахол жительница города Дангара. Ей 45 лет. Она вдова. У нее двое сыновей. Один младший сын находится в Москве а старший живет вместе с ней. Пардахол вместе с сыном занимается торговлей на рынке. Она арендует торговую точку, где продает овощи (болгарский перец и огурцы). Торговлей Пардахол занимается десять лет. Она берет кредит для покупки помидоров, огурцов, капусты, чеснока, тыквы и фруктов. Таким образом она хочет увеличить оборот и соответственно получать больше прибыли.
texts.en:
Pardakhol lives in the city of Dangara. She is 45 years old, widowed, and has two sons. Her youngest son is presently in Moscow, while the eldest lives with her. Together, they work at the market where they rent a retail spot and sell vegetables (sweet peppers and cucumbers). This has been Pardakhol's occupation for ten years.

Pardakhol is taking this loan to purchase tomatoes, cucumbers, cabbage, garlic and pumpkins. By doing so, she would like to increase the volume of her sales and earn a better profit.

loans.use: to purchase tomatoes, cucumbers, cabbage, garlic, pumpkins and fruit.

loans.name: Dana Kerti Group

texts.en:
The Dana Kerti group requests their new loan with the same loan amount as their previous loan. The group has a new member this loan cycle. With a total of 10 members, the group is borrowing 15M IDR.

Although she had a loss in the last loan period, Jro Ayu used her loan to purchase 2 superior piglets for fattening. With supervision by the Vet and the Loan Officer, she hopes the piglets will not be attacked by disease. To avoid disease, she’s already sterilized the barn with a chemical spray. The profit from this business is used to grow the business by purchasing more piglets.

loans.use: To purchase 2 superior piglets for fattening

loans.name: Azucena

texts.es:
la señora Azucena  vela por la salud de la población ya que su profesión es auxiliar de enfermería  brinda ese servicio a la comunidad desde hace 38 años,  es una persona importante en el medio, es soltera  con 1 nieto  al que  apoya en su formación académica, actualmente tiene una necesidad inmediata como es la construcción de un porche, quiosco y reparación de la misma.
por eso solicita a ceprodel un financiamiento para solventar tal situación, ya que lo utilizara para la compra de angulares, cerámica, malla expandida de ½, bonder sur `plus, bolsa de porcelana, zinc y mano de obra,  de esa manera mejorar las condiciones y nivel de vida.
texts.en:
As a nursing assistant, Azucena watches over the health of the town.  She has provided this service to the community for 38 years.  She is an important person there.  She is single and has one grandson whose education she supports.  

She currently has an immediate need to do construction on a porch, a kiosk, and repair them.  In order to do this, she has requested a loan from Ceprodel.  She will use it to purchase foundation stones, tiles, 1/2 expanded mesh, grout, a bag of porcelain, metal sheeting, and pay for laborers.  In this way, she will improve her living conditions and way of life.

loans.use: to purchase foundation stones, tiles, 1/2 expanded mesh, grout, a bag of porcelain, cement, metal sheeting, and pay for laborers

loans.name: Mansueta

texts.en: Mansueta is single with 1 child. She is 53 years old and lives in Rizal, Zamboanga del Norte. Mansueta owns and operates a plot of farm land, planting bananas to earn a living. She has been in this business for 4 years and earns PHP 3,000 each month. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase farm chemicals. Mansueta is a new member of Kiva's partner, GDMPC. In the future, Mansueta's plan is to save her profits in order to buy a car.

loans.use: to purchase farm chemicals

loans.name: Margarito

texts.en: Margarito is 60 years old and is married with 4 kids. He is from Decoloc, Plaridel where his banana production land is located. He was just 20 years old when he started cultivating this land. At the end of the month, Margarito gets PHP 8,000, which he equally divides for his family. Margarito joined GDMPC this year to access financial services offered by the cooperative. He has borrowed PHP 10,000 to buy fertilizer. He hopes to plant sooner so as not to waste time. Margarito plans of expansion of his business array.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Newaongo Group

texts.fr:
Mme MADELEINE  représente le groupe  NEWAONGO. Mariée, elle est mère de 02 enfants. Le plus âgé a 20ans et le moins âgé a 13ans. 02 vont à l’école et elle a 02 personnes en charge.
Mme est coiffeuse vend des mèches  depuis 10ans.  Elle s’approvisionne  à Sankar  yaar. Ses clients sont les femmes.
Mme veut s’acheter  20 paquets de mèches ; 40 boites de produits pour cheveux. 
Mme veut épargner  ses  bénéfices. Elle ambitionne acheter un motocycle et assurer la charge de ses enfants (scolarité, habillement et fourniture…).
texts.en:
Ms. MADELEINE represents the group NEWAONGO. She is a married mother of two children. The oldest is 20 years old, and the youngest is 13, and both go to school. Ms. MADELEINE  is a hairdresser and has been selling hair extensions for ten years. She gets her supplies in Sankar Yaar. Her customers are women. 

Ms. MADELEINE wants to purchase 20 packets of hair extensions and 40 containers of haircare products. She wants to save her profits. Her ambition is to purchase a motorcycle and to ensure that her children's expenses (school fees, clothing, school supplies…) are covered.

loans.use: to purchase hair extensions and haircare products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase phone minutes cards, chipsets... to sell

loans.name: Gregory

texts.en:
Watching his dad transform his carpentry hobby into a contracting business helped inspire 10-year-old Greg’s dream to one day own a business. When he grew up – turning 29 this past summer – Greg realized his dream by merging his love for cycling with the transportation industry to create a taxi service called Little Rock Pedicab in Little Rock, Arkansas.

Greg took four months to put his thoughts together, order bikes, purchase insurance, and become licensed; he’s currently waiting on inspections to approve the bikes before he can completely operate. “One thing I’m trying to process is making sure it’s a safe and enjoyable ride,” Greg says. “I just want people to enjoy themselves and not be concerned about the ride.” 

He also carefully researched the pedicab industry to be certain he made the safest cabs possible.  For example, when he discovered many bicycle wrecks were reported because trolley tracks are wide enough for bicycle tires to get stuck between, Greg outfitted his pedicabs with wider motorcycle tires that can’t get stuck.  He also learned that Arkansas come in last among the United States when it comes to bicycle participation – so he is now on a mission to improve that rating.

Greg’s pedicabs carry up to 700 pounds and have a top speed of about 20 miles per hour.  However, he doesn’t think he’ll be going that fast. “When you take your time getting somewhere, you actually get to see the world around you and really enjoy it,” he says.

At the moment, Greg employs himself and rents to a handful of subcontractors who serve as drivers.  He hopes to grow a demand for pedicabs in Little Rock and then expand, but he says he would not be at this point in his business had he not received a loan from Accion Texas Inc.  While looking into lenders, Greg found the majority of them required a business owner to already be in business before they were considered for a loan. Accion was one of the only lenders he found that assisted start-up businesses. 

The majority of his loan went to purchase the pedicabs, the rest went to insurance and other start-up costs.  “The Accion Texas loan really started the process of owning my own business. Without it, I wouldn’t have started my business now.  I would have had to wait for years, because most lenders wouldn’t lend to beginners.”

Greg says, “Thanks to Accion for helping me accomplish the dream I had since I was a kid. Traditional banks didn’t believe in me, but talking to people at Accion made me feel that they believed in me, the person behind the business. Thanks for believing.” 

Find out more about Greg’s business at his Website: http://lrpedicab.com/; Facebook page: https://www.facebook.com/LittleRockPedicab; and Twitter page: http://twitter.com/lrpedicab.

loans.use: To purchase cabs and market his business.

loans.name: Olga  Maria

texts.es:
Olga, es una humilde comerciante de 36 años de edad, habitante de la ciudad de León, casada, madre de dos hijos de 11 y 5 años de edad. Ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de tortillas , frijoles y cuajadas, actividad que realiza desde hace 9 años en su humilde cocina hecha de piedra y lata viejas, solo finalizo la primaria pues gran parte de su vida la dedico al trabajo para ayudar con los alimentos en su hogar . Su  esposo es albañil y con lo poco que gana aporta para los gastos del hogar.
Ella está solicitando financiamiento para comprar leña, frijoles, cuajadas y maíz. Pues le ayudara a conseguir materia prima para trabajar y ofrecer desayunos a su clientela como una nueva forma de diversificar su negocio, donde además de vender tortillas calientes sus clientes puedan encontrar unos ricos frijoles fritos con cuajadas para desayunar.
texts.en:
Olga is a humble businesswoman who lives in the city of León.  She is 36 year old, married, and mother of two children, ages 11 and 5.  She makes and sells “tortillas”, “frijoles”, and “cuajadas” (a dessert made from flavored milk and rennet).  She has been doing this activity for nine years from her humble kitchen, made of stones and old sheet metal.  She only completed primary school because she dedicated most of her life to working to help provide food for the household.  Her husband is a bricklayer and contributes the small amount he earns toward the household expenses.

She is requesting this loan to purchase firewood, beans, “cuajadas”, and corn.  This will help her obtain ingredients to work and enable her to diversify her business by offering breakfast to her customers.  In addition to hot tortillas, her customers will find delicious “frijoles fritos (fried beans) con cuajadas” for breakfast.

loans.use: to purchase firewood, beans, “cuajadas”, and corn.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Since March 2012, Aida and Tom have been the proud owners of Cafe Manhattan, a small coffee shop in San Diego’s North County. 

Located next to the town's car wash, the coffee shop and café has a steady stream of hungry clientele who praise Cafe Manhattan for their fresh coffee and delicious crepes. These delicacies are stuffed with fresh ingredients such as baby spinach, applewood smoked bacon and Swiss cheese, while desert crepes are made with melted chocolate ganache or fresh lemon juice. They also serve fine paninis and fresh fruit smoothies. 

Cafe Manhattan is a family-run business. Their daughter often helps out in the business, and Aida and Tom enjoy the flexibility they now have to spend time as a family.  They also love interacting with their loyal customer base.

After struggling with their revenue during the recession, Tom and Aida are looking to secure a stable income stream for their shop. Tom also works as a real estate agent to supplement the family's income, which is also why he was not present when the picture was taken.

They will use their $8,100 Kiva loan to purchase new equipment such as an oven hood, increase menu options and better serve their clients. As their business grows, they hope to someday open a second location.

Find Cafe Manhattan on Facebook: www.facebook.com/CafeManhattanEncinitas

loans.use: to purchase new equipment such as an oven hood, increase menu options and better serve their clients

loans.name: Tuyatsetseg

texts.en:
Mrs. Tuyatsetseg is 26 years old and  lives with her mother and two younger brothers in small house in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her younger brothers work in a private company. She has been working in an organic vegetable selling company as a salesperson. She has lot of experience in fruit and vegetable selling and now she is opening her own organic fruit and vegetable selling business in a rental counter at market. 

She is requesting 4,000,000 MNT to purchase large amounts of organic vegetables and fruit from Ulaanbaatar at wholesale prices for her business. She is a diligent, welcoming and friendly young woman.

loans.use: To purchase large amount of organic vegetables and fruits from Ulaanbaatar at wholesale prices

loans.name: Juana

texts.en:
Juana is 41-year-old married woman and mother of two school-aged children from Loon, Bohol. She has been engaged in a fish vending business for several years now. She is also engaged in a hog raising business. Her husband works as a fisherman.

Juana wants to access a loan to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, and buckets. Juana believes that the loan could definitely improve her business and augment her income.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, and buckets

loans.name: Ramonita

texts.en: Ramonita is from Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She's 57 years old and is married with two children. To make a living, Ramonita sells herbal medicines, herbal soap and any herbal alternative. She has been in her business for 8 years and earns 15,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Ramonita joined GDMPC. She is requesting a loan of 25,000 PHP which will be used to buy more herbal products to sell. She plans on using the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

loans.use: to buy more herbal products to sell

loans.name: Lozila

texts.en:
Lozila has been in the hog-raising business for several years now. She is 48 years old and has three young children.

Lozila is requesting a loan to buy feed and additional piglets to raise. She believes that this loan could help her in realizing her dream of making her business grow and become sustainable.

Moreover, Lozila wants to save money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy feed and additional piglets to raise.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita of Looc, Plaridel supports her family through her dressmaking or sewing business. She is a 64-year-old married mom of eight children. She tries her best to earn on her own. 

For 30 years, she has managed this business and earns about PHP 8,000 per month. For the time being, she is in need of buying sewing materials such as textiles, thread, etc. 

She joined in 2009 and thanks GDMPC microfinance for the loan of PHP 18,000 they are providing to her. 

Teresita desires to improve her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy sewing materials such as textiles, thread, etc.

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma is 58 years old and lives in Libertad, Sapang Dalaga. She is married and the mother of two children. 

Thelma has a banana and snack food vending business to earn a living. She has been in this type of business for 30 years. She earns 5,000 PHP each month from these activities. 

Thelma has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC to purchase bananas and some snack food items to sell. She's a new member of GDMPC. 

In the future, Thelma hopes to expand her snack vending business.

loans.use: to purchase bananas and some snack food items to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more animal feed to resell

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.en:
Narcisa is a married woman and a mother of three children from Loon, Bohol. She has been engaged in the hog raising business for several years now. This is the source of her income.

Narcisa works hard to assist her husband in meeting the needs of the family. Narcisa is requesting a loan to buy feed and additional piglets to raise.

In the future, Narcisa hopes to expand her business and make it a success.

loans.use: to buy feed and additional piglets to raise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sacks of rice to resell

loans.name: Purita

texts.en:
Purita works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines. Purita is borrowing PHP 1650  through NWTF to buy a SOLAR LAMP.

She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to save money by minimizing her kerosene expenses.

Purita is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is saving money, she is helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to purchase a solar lamp

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more meat to sell.

loans.name: Nerio

texts.en:
Nerio is a forty-eight-year-old married man from Panglao, Bohol.  He has four children.The oldest child is twenty years old while the youngest is twelve. 

Nerio has been in the fishing business for twenty years. He catches fish and sell it at the market. He requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy fishing materials like fishing net and a container for fish storage. Nerio would like to invest in other ventures to support his family's needs and at the same time save for the education of his children.

loans.use: to buy fishing net and a container for fish storage

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is a 65-year-old widow from Catagbacan, Loon, Bohol. She has two grown-up children. Erlinda has been engaged in the hog raising business for three years now. This is her source of income.

Erlinda is asking for a loan to buy more piglets to raise and feed for the pigs.  She dreams of expanding her business and making it a success.

loans.use: to buy more piglets to raise and feed for the pigs

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en:
Mercedita is 46 years old and married with three children. With all children in school, Mercedita works very hard to provide for them. 

Mercedita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 25,000 Philippine Peso (PHP) loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell. 

Mercedita has been in this business for 11 years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, bread, soft-drinks and other groceries. 

In the future Mercedita would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery items such snack foods, canned goods and other groceries.

loans.name: Pechie

texts.en:
Peche is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a clothing sales business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 18,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) through NWTF to purchase additional ready-to-wear clothing to sell. 

NWTF is relisting Peche's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional ready-to-wear clothing to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 22,000 through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell to her customers.

NWTF is presenting Helen's business for funding of another loan in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is from Acad, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 50 years old. Erlinda is married and has six children. 

To make a living, Erlinda owns and operates a specialized general store. She has been engaged in her business for five years and earns 4,000 PHP a month for these activities. 

In 2007, Erlinda joined GDMPC. She is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items such as candies, Milo (a brand of malted milk), shampoo, soaps, etc. 

She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase new items such as candies, Milo, shampoo, soaps, etc.

loans.name: Naicy

texts.es: Naicy de 21 años de edad vive en el sur de la ciudad y se dedica a la venta de mercancías variadas y de dulce, desde hace tres años, cuando comenzó como alternativa de ingresos comercializada directamente al consumidor final, ubicado en el sector de su vecindad. Su negocio ha ido creciendo poco apoco y en él vende de contado y con una frecuencia diaria trabajando 12 horas continuas desde las 8 de la mañana. Con ello planea responder al sustento propio y especialmente de su pequeño hijo de dos años, con quien sueña un futuro de prosperidad. Su meta más adelante es tener un local en un lugar de mayor movimiento comercial, que impulsen sus ventas desde el punto de contacto, pero su mayor desafío es no tener el suficiente capital de trabajo para lograr su crecimiento sostenido. En la actualidad está aplicando a su primer credikiva, con el cual comprará  diversos dulces, que agraden las fiestas de Halloween a los niños y Naicy hará su buena venta. Así mismo comprará ropa, calzado, para surtir su negocio y poder responder a la demanda que se avecina a consecuencia de las fiestas de fin de año, donde las familias estarán unidas, alegres y bien vestidas con la ropa que venderá Naicy cuando invierta su credikiva..
texts.en:
Naicy, 21, lives in the southern part of the city and sells different merchandise and sweets.  She has been in business for three years and started earning this extra income by selling directly to end consumers in her neighborhood on a cash basis.  Business has been growing little by little, and her work schedule is an average 12 hours a day beginning at 8:00 a.m.  She plans to cover her own expenses as well as those of her two-year-old son, for whom she dreams of a prosperous future.  

Her goal is to have her own establishment one day in a more active commercial location, so she can sell more volume.  But her greatest challenge is not having enough capital to sustain growth.  Currently, she is applying for her first CrediKiva loan to buy a variety of sweets, especially for Halloween, which will give Naicy a high sales volume.  She will also buy clothing and shoes to stock her business and be able to respond to the high demand for the New Year's parties, when families get together and celebrate, dressed in clothing sold by Naicy once she gets the CrediKiva loan.

loans.use: To buy a variety sweets, as well as clothing and shoes in order to fill orders.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more meat to resell

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
As a widowed mother of three children, Nenita works hard to support her family.

She earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from running a general store. Nenita is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers for her vegetables.

Nenita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 8 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her vegetables.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Elizabeth works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from hog-raising.  Elizabeth is borrowing PHP 22,000 through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell for her general store business.

Elizabeth has been sustaining her business activities through her past 13 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Susan requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food business.

She has been in this business for ten years.

In the future, Susan would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more hotdogs and barbeque to resell.

loans.name: Rosila

texts.en:
Rosila is from Bayabas, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 40 years old, married, and has 7 children. 

To make a living, Rosila runs a general store, selling a variety of food and home use products in the local community. Rosila has had her business for 2 years, and earns 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

Rosila is requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products like canned goods, noodles, sugar and coffee. 

In 2010, Rosila joined GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase additional products like canned goods, noodles, sugar and coffee

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages for sale.

loans.name: Rodney

texts.en:
Rodney, 34, is married with one child and lives in the Philippines.

Rodney operates a business providing transportation services to local community members. He has been doing this for two years, and every month he earns 3,000 PHP. 

Rodney has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to repair his motorcycle so he can provide better service. Rodney been a member of GDMPC since 2009. In the future, he hopes to double his business income.

loans.use: to repair his motorcycle for better service.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie, a 59-year-old farmer, is married with two children and lives in the Philippines. Rosemarie plants and harvests rice crops, which she sells to earn a living. She has been doing this for 11 years, and every month she earns 18,910 PHP from this work. 

Rosemarie has requested a loan of 50,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer, such as manure. Rosemarie been a member of GDMPC since 2009. She hopes to have a good harvest this year.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages to resell.

loans.name: Reyna De Los Angeles Group

texts.es:
Mary es miembro del grupo Reyna De Los Ángeles; ella tiene 45 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene un hijo de 21 años que trabaja y estudia. Mary empezó con su negocio hace 20 años, su esposo dejó su trabajo en una compañía para dedicarse a trabajar juntos; fue así que empezaron a confeccionar gorras, bufones y diferentes souvenirs deportivos. Sus principales clientes son las personas que acuden a los estadios, ellos mismos comercializan sus productos y se dedican a la venta. Mary se siente feliz por su  negocio sobre todo cuando las ventas son buenas, con el préstamo obtenido comprará telas para seguir confeccionando sus prendas y también comprará polos deportivos algo que es de mucha demanda entre sus clientes, su mayor sueño es dedicarse a la confección de polos, por ahora no lo hace porque es una inversión mayor; pero espera lograrlo muy pronto. Mary esta agradecida por su trabajo que le permite una mejor economía para su hogar, también está muy agradecida con los inversionistas de KIVA quienes le permiten obtener su préstamo tanto a ella como a su grupo.

*En la fotografía Mary viste chompa negra. La que se encuentra al lado izquierdo de la fotografía es la Sra. Nelly que viste una chompa rosada y tiene una cartera negra.
texts.en:
Mary, 45, is a member of Reyna de los Ángeles Group.  She lives with her partner and has a 21-year-old son who works and goes to school.  Mary began with her business 20 years ago.  Her husband left his job in a company so they could make a living working together.  This is how they started making caps and various sports souvenirs.

Their main customers are people who go to stadiums.  They sell their products themselves and make a living in sales.  Mary's happy about her business, especially when sales are good.

With the loan she's going to buy fabric to continue making garments and she'll also buy sports polo shirts, which are in great demand among her customers.

Her biggest dream is to make a living sewing polo shirts.  For now she's not doing it because it's a major investment, but she hopes to do it very soon.

Mary's grateful for her job, which allows her better finances for her household.  She's also very grateful to the Kiva lenders, who allow her and her group to get their loan.

*Mary's the first in line, wearing a black sweater.  On the left side is Sra. Nelly, who is wearing a pink jacket and has a black purse.

loans.use: to buy fabric and sport shirts

loans.name: Lamentation De Philibert Group

texts.fr:
Manoucheca est la coordinatrice de son groupe Lamentation de Philibert. elle est célibataire. Manoucheca habite dans la région de  Ferrier d’Haiti où de l’éléctricité est rare et de l’eau est très limité. 

Manoucheca a dirigé son  commerce de vetement pendant les 6 dernières années. Elle voudrait utiliser cet emprunt pour investir avec duit du vetement et cosmetique.  Manoucheca  espère que cet emprunt l’aidera à agrandir son business

Des autres membres du Lamentation de Philibert ont besoin d’un emprunt pour tels commerces comme charbon, chaussures et cosmetiques produit. Manoucheca dit que son but principal sont un femme d'affaires.
texts.en:
Manoucheca is the coordinator of her group Lamentation de Philibert. She is unmarried and lives in the Ferrier region of Haiti, where electricity is rare and water is very limited. 

Manoucheca has been running her clothing business for the last six years. She would like to use this loan to invest in clothing items and cosmetic products. She hopes that this loan will help her to expand her business.

Other members of Lamentation de Philibert need a loan for businesses, such as in charcoal, shoes, and cosmetics. Manoucheca says that her main goal is to become a businesswoman.

loans.use: to purchase clothing to sell

loans.name: Luisa Amanda

texts.es:
La Señora Luisa Amanda trabaja para una escuela pública en el municipio de Nagarote desde hace 29 años como profesora de primaria con lo que ha sacado adelante su familia quien la conforma ella y dos hijos, brindándole estudio, alimentación y demás necesidades básicas de un hogar siendo madre soltera.

Actualmente es su primer crédito y lo quiere para realizarse exámenes médicos computarizados y medicamentos ya que actualmente está pasando por una crisis de salud.
texts.en:
Mrs. Luisa Amanda has been working as a primary school teacher for a public school in the Municipality of Nagarote for twenty-nine years. By doing so, she has been able to support her family, which is composed of her and her two children. She has been able to pay for their education, their food and other basic needs that a single-parent home has.

She is now requesting her first loan and wants to use it for medical tests and medicines that she requires, because she is going through a health crisis.

loans.use: to pay for medical tests and medicines.

loans.name: Jose De Jesus

texts.es:
El señor  José,  se dedica a su negocio de Prestación de servicios de transporte taxi, desde hace cinco años, se encuentra ubicado en un punto muy bueno ya que esta asignado a un punto de taxis de un Mall de la Ciudad,  contando también con mucho clientes que lo llaman para solicitarle sus servicios lo prefieren por su buena atención
Don José esta solicitando crédito por valor de L. 15,000.00 para reparación y mantenimiento de uno de sus vehículo ya que le esta dando algunos problemas y quiere tenerlo en optimas condiciones.
Don José espera que su negocio se convierta en un negocio estable para seguir trabajando y ayudar a su familia.
Tegucigalpa, Honduras – Octubre 2012
texts.en:
José has been working in his business providing taxi service for the last five years.  He’s located in a very good spot because he’s assigned to a taxi stand at one of the city’s malls.  He also has many customers that call him for service and prefer him for his good customer service.

José is requesting a loan for 15,000 Lempiras to repair and service on of his vehicles that’s been giving him a few problems and he wants it to be in optimum condition.  José hopes his business will become a stable business so he can continue working to help his family.

Tegucigalpa, Honduras-October, 2012

loans.use: to buy spare parts and lubricant for his taxi.

loans.name: Jairo Antonio

texts.es:
El Señor Jairo Antonio trabaja  en un colegio de la Ciudad de León desempeñando el cargo de docente,  el señor  sale de su casa de habitación 12:00 md inicia sus labores 12:45 md  finalizando  a las 6:00 pm  con este mismo horario de lunes a viernes, Por la mañana  dedica dos hora para la planificación de la clase del día siguiente,  Jairo Antonio es  padre  de tres  hijos con edades 11 , 7 y 5 años de edad. 

Jairo solicita un crédito a Ceprodel  el que  utilizara  para cubrir gastos  escolares  como es la graduación de  su hijo mayor, mas pago de aranceles de los otros dos hijos.

Los sueños de Jairo Antonio, es que sus hijos logren una carrera profesional y realizar  mejora a  su vivienda.
texts.en:
Jairo Antonio works as a teacher in a school in the city of León.  He leaves home at noon to start work at 12:45pm ending at 6pm, Monday through Friday.  He spends mornings doing his lesson plans for the next day.  Jairo Antonio is the father of three children whose ages are 11, 7 and 5.  

Jairo is asking Ceprodel for a loan he’ll use to pay his oldest son’s graduation expenses plus his two other children’s school fees.  Jairo Antonio’s dream is that his children attain professional careers and to make some home improvements.

loans.use: to pay graduation expenses.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for motorcycle maintenance.

loans.name: Ronna

texts.en:
Ronna works hard to support three children. She is married and has a ready to wear business in the Philippines.

Ronna requested a PHP 1,800 loan through NWTF to buy a SOLAR LAMP.

She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to provide her children with bright light when they study at night.

Ronna is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to purchase of solar lamp

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en:
Sylvia is 48 years old and a mixed crop farmer. She is married to Robert, a business man. They are blessed with four school-going children. She has been in the farming business for the past 15 years and earns a monthly income of 15,000 KES, which she uses to support her family. 

Sylvia is applying for her first loan after being introduced by an existing KADET customer. Sylvia will use the loan to buy farm inputs like fertilizer and organic manure for planting bananas. 

With the anticipated profit from the business she will educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to improve her dairy farming business.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs like fertilizer and organic manure

loans.name: Floresha

texts.en:
Floresha a is 35-year-old Roma. She is a hard worker and a married mother of two school-aged children, 12 and 8. They live in the suburbs of a little town in the southeastern Albania. 

She does not live the same as other members of her community who live in the same neighborhood and are called “Roma Lagje.” She has integrated well with the rest of population from other communities and lives in harmony with them. All neighbors made the best comments about her to the loan officer who helped Floresha with the loan paperwork.

In the past five years, Floresha has been active in the agricultural stream; she rents some land from neigbours where she plants during all seasons (mainly veggies) and then sell the products to the local market. She makes a profit, which she said is enough just to give the basics to the children.

Floresha now is applying for a loan to buy seedlings and seeds.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and seeds.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods,snacks and beverages

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is 34 years old; he is single, but supports his parents. He buys, sells, and transports charcoal to his customers. 

He has been in business for the past two years, with a monthly income of KES. 20,000, which he uses for his basic needs, and the support of his parents. 

He is applying for his first loan term from KADET LTD, after being introduced by an existing KADET LTD customer. George will use the loan to buy more sacks of charcoal in bulk for sale, especially during the high season. With the anticipated profit, he will expand his business. 

His hopes and dreams are to save, expand his business, and own a big lorry to transport his charcoal. He currently hires a pickup for transport, which is very costly.

loans.use: To buy more sacks of charcoal in bulk for sale

loans.name: Adem

texts.en:
Adem is thirty years old, married, and has one son. He lives in a village together with parents, and his brother, who is also married. 

Adem is a very ambitious and hardworking man. Based on family tradition, he used to work in an agricultural business, working on their land planting wheat. However, in order to get more income for his family, he took a second job as a guard. He is the main source of income for his family.

Adem is requesting a loan to buy wheat seed for planting, guano, and to pay for his new tractor, which he uses for planting wheat seed. This loan will help them provide food for two years for their entire family. 

Adem hopes to continue to develop his own business, as his goal is to save the money for the children’s future. He is very gratefully to all Kiva lenders!

loans.use: To buy wheat seed for planting, guano and to pay for his new tractor.

loans.name: Norma Gregoria

texts.es: la señora norma es originaria de un  poblado de Larreynaga departamento de león, se desempeña como maestra de primaria con 3 años de laborar impartiendo clases, su núcleo familiar está conformado por 3 personas incluyendo su hijo, en edad escolar, es madre soltera, tiene un problema de discapacidad que no le impide realizar su labor como docente de educación primaria; esta señora  solicita un financiamiento para la compra de piedrín, arena, cemento, bloques, hierro, varilla lisa, acarreo y mano de obra, para mejorar su casa la que está en mal estado,  por eso se decidió visitar las oficinas de ceprodel para ser beneficiada con el financiamiento y lograr el objetivo planteado y de esa manera mejorar sus condiciones y nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Norma is from Larreynaga, León Department.  She’s been working as an elementary school teacher teaching class for three years.  Her nuclear family is composed of three people including a school age son; she’s a single mother.  She has a disability that does not keep her from being able to do her job as an elementary school teacher.

She’s requesting a loan to buy gravel, sand, cement, concrete blocks, rebar and smooth rods as well as to pay delivery and labor costs in order to make improvements to her home which is in poor state.  Because of this, she visited Ceprodel’s offices to be benefitted with a loan to attain her set goal thus improving her living conditions and standard of living.

loans.use: to buy building supplies and pay labor costs.

loans.name: Nena

texts.en:
Nena is a 43-year-old married woman from Corella, Bohol. She has five children; the oldest child is fourteen while the youngest is five. 

Nena has been engaged in a motorcycle shop business for six years. She accepts repairs on motorcycles in their community for a certain fee. Her husband is a mechanic specializing in motorcycle part repairs. He is the one who helps Nena operate the business.

She has requested a loan of 3,000 PHP to buy additional tools, like wrenches and a clutch puller.

Nena would like to expand her business to build a big and spacious shop, while at the same time saving for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy motorcycle tools such as wrenches and a clutch puller.

loans.name: Danny Josue

texts.es:
Danny, un joven de 21 años de edad, soltero, originario de León, estudiante de la carrera de Ingeniería Industrial. Se dedica a vender ropa usada y nueva, inicio trabajando con su madre a los 14 años ella fue quien le enseño y la ayudo a tener su propio negocio. El sale a vender a las afueras de la ciudad León donde tiene la mayoría de su clientela.  
El esta requiriendo el financiamiento para comprar ropa nueva y usada para vender. Esto le permitirá comprar más inventario pues necesita tener mercadería sobre todo porque viene la época navideña donde las ventas son muy buenas y no quiere perder la oportunidad de vender. Su meta es terminar su carrera y poner más tiendas de ropa usada y nueva.
texts.en:
Danny, 21, is a young, single man from León.  He’s studying industrial engineering.  He sells new and used clothes.  He started out working with his mother at the age of 14; she taught him and helped him get his own business. He sells in the outskirts of León which is where he has most of his customers.

He needs financing to buy new and used clothes to sell.  This will make it possible for him to buy more inventory because he needs to have more merchandise especially now that the Christmas season is approaching which is when sales are very good and he does not want to lose this sales opportunity.  His goal is to complete his career and open more used and new clothes stores.

loans.use: to buy new and used clothes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for the maintenance

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is married and has four children. She operates the grocery shop in the picture above at Aburasa, near Elmina. She has operated this store for the past four years. Her husband is a carpenter.  

Sarah uses her income to help her husband pay for the general upkeep of their home. Sarah will use the loan to purchase a variety of groceries to satisfy her customers. With the new profits from her improved income, Sarah plans to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of groceries to satisfy her customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods,snacks and beverages to sell in her store.

loans.name: Seth

texts.en:
Seth sells grinding stones in Aburasa, near Elmina. He is married and has three children. His wife is a farmer. 

Seth has been selling grinding stones for the past 20 years. He is responsible for paying his children's school fees. He will use the loan to buy more  grinding stones to sell. He hopes to use the new profits to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy more grinding stones to sell.

loans.name: Apolonia

texts.en:
Apolonia is a 36-year-old married woman and a mother of five young children from Maribojoc, Bohol. She has been running a convenience store business known as a sari-sari store for more than five years now. 

Apolonia is requesting a loan to buy more stock to sell in her store such as noodles, chips and snack foods, candies, soda, soap and shampoos and others items. 

In the future, Apolonia dreams of making her business a success and increase her income so that she can provide her children an education for a bright future.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell in her store such as noodles, snack foods, candies, soda, soap, shampoo, etc.

loans.name: Enea

texts.en:
Enea is a 27-year-old single ethnic Romani man from southeastern Albania.  He lives in the suburbs of a major city, where the majority of his community lives. He’s got goals: to get married soon, have children, and open up a store to sell used items (instead of selling them in the streets).

Enea has been selling used shoes for the past two years, and now he wants to add more inventory of used items to resell. This is the reason that he has requested a loan of 50,000 Albanian Lek, thinking that even though is a small loan, it will still be of great help to him. 

This would be Enea’s first loan, yet he plans on applying for a larger sum after this to expand the activity.

loans.use: To add more inventory of used items to resell.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is 50 years old, married, and blessed with three children. His wife is a farmer, who also supports their family. He has been earning a living through a welding business for the past twelve years, earning a monthly income of 60,000 KES.

This will be his fifth loan from KADET LTD, and he has applied for 55,000 KES, with which he plans to buy materials for metal manufacturing work, such as nails, metals and polishing materials.

With the anticipated profit, he plans to expand his business and offer employment in the community. His dreams and hopes for future are to be stable and to be a wealthy farmer.

loans.use: to purchase materials for metal manufacturing work, such as nails, metals and polishing materials

loans.name: Kwame

texts.en:
Kwame is married and has five children. He has received schooling through the junior high school level. Kwame operates a grocery store at Aburasa, near Elmina. He has operated his store for the past five years. His wife is a petty trader. 

Kwame uses his income to pay his children's school fees. Kwame will use the loan to purchase a variety of groceries to satisfy his customers. With the new profits, Kwame plans to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of groceries to satisfy his customers.

loans.name: Fernando Jose

texts.es:
El señor Fernando tiene 71 años de edad, es casado tiene 3 hijos y vive en una colonia suburbana de San Pedro Sula. Don Fernando se dedicaba anteriormente a la venta de libros y hace 12 años decidió establecer su propio negocio de fabricación de pizarras de todo tipo y tamaño para uso en yeso y acrílicas. Este producto lo vende en el mercado de la ciudad, empresas y  comerciales, vende por docenas y por pedidos. 
El ha sido cliente de ODEF en varios ciclos de préstamos para inversión de su negocio, y actualmente ha solicitado otro préstamo por 10,000 Lempiras con el cual va comprar la materia prima como madera, laminas acrílicas, mazonite y pegamento. Con esta inversión va ampliar el negocio esperando incrementar las ventas y los ingresos. Tiene como meta comprar un vehículo para salir a vender su producto.
texts.en:
Fernando, 71 is married and has 3 children.  He lives in a suburban neighborhood of San Pedro Sula.  Fernando used to sell books, but 12 years ago he decided to start his own business making writing boards of all types and sizes for use with chalk and markers.  He sells his products in the market in his city and to companies and traders, and he also sells them by the dozen and by advance order.

Fernando has been a client of ODEF for a number of loan cycles, and he has been investing in his business.  He is currently requesting another loan for 10,000 Honduran lempiras, so that he can buy supplies such as wood, sheets of acrylic, hardboard and glue. With this investment he is going to expand his business, hoping to increase his sales and his income.  His goal is to buy a vehicle that he could use to go out and sell his products.

loans.use: to buy raw materials to make chalkboards/whiteboards, such as wood, glue, acrylic paint, nails and other supplies

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a single woman who is 38 years old. She has five children who are all in school. She operates a food restaurant in Nairobi. She has been in this business for one and half years now. Florence earns a monthly income of 75,000 KES.

This will be Florence's second loan. She plans to use the entire loan to buy utensils, a gas cylinder and chairs for her restaurant business. Florence believes that with these items, she will be in a better position to offer good service to her customers who are mostly residents and employees in the Nairobi area.

In the future, she wants to open a bigger restaurant and also educate her children.

loans.use: to buy utensils, a gas cylinder and chairs for her restaurant business.

loans.name: Nana

texts.en:
Nana is married and has four children. Nana is a fish monger and she also sells kenkey (a sourdough dumpling dish) in Aburasa, near Elmina. She has operated this business for the past six years. Her husband is a tailor. 

Nana uses her income to help her husband pay for the general upkeep of their home. Nana will use the loan to purchase bags of maize and fresh fish to fry. With the new profits, Nana plans to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase bags of maize and fresh fish to fry.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stock of canned goods,snacks and beverages to sell in her business.

loans.name: Mena

texts.en: Mena  is married and has 5 children. She sells rice and gari (a staple food made out of cassava) at Aburasa near Elmina, which she has done for 4 years. Her husband is a fisherman. Mena uses her income to assist her husband in the general upkeep of their home. Mena will use the loan to purchase bags of rice and gari to sell. With the new profits, Mena plans to expand her business

loans.use: to purchase bags of rice and gari to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages to resell

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 45-year-old single woman, and has one child aged seventeen.  She is a tailor in Nderi Zambezi in the outskirts of Limuru. She has been in this business for twelve years and she gets a monthly income of thirty-nine thousand shillings.

This will be Mary's first loan with KADET LTD.  She plans to use the entire loan to purchase fabric materials for dressmaking and also buy ready made clothes for sale. 

In future she wants to become a successful business woman.

loans.use: To purchase fabric materials and new dresses for sale.

loans.name: Fidela

texts.en:
Fidela is a forty-three-year-old married woman from Panglao, Bohol. She has eight children. The oldest child is nineteen and the youngest is eight. Fidela sells fish. She has been in the fish vending business for thirty years. Her husband is a fisherman and also contributes the family's daily consumption of food.

She requested a loan of PHP 4,000 to buy more fish and a new container for fish storage. In the future, Fidela would like to increase her fish selling business to support her family as well as to finance the education of her children for a brighter future.

loans.use: to buy more fish, and a new container for fish storage.

loans.name: Juan Luis

texts.es:
Juan tiene 34 años de edad, es conviviente, y con 3 hijos. Vive en casa propia, la cual está ubicada en el Caserío Capac Yupanqui Distrito de Tambogrande. Cliente vive en la parte rural  de este distrito. Solo cuenta con el servicio básico de luz.

La actividad que desarrolla Juan es la crianza de ganado ovino contando a la fecha con 21 cabezas los cuales cría engorda y comercializa en el mercado local, además cría aves de corral, cuenta con más de 7 años de experiencia en el manejo de su negocio.  Con los ingresos que percibe cubre sus gastos y los de su familia.

Juan desea acelerar el desarrollo de su ganado, por lo que comprará más alimento balanceado para los ovinos y además para sus aves de corral, asimismo realizará mejoras en el corral para así venderlos a un mejor precio y por ende lograr una mejor calidad de vida.  Es por ello que ha creído conveniente obtener un préstamo de 1000 nuevos soles en Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
Juan, 34, has a spouse and three children.  He lives in his own house located in Capac Yupanqui, Tambogrande District.  He lives in the rural part of this district and the only utility he has is electricity.

Juan raises sheep and to date has 21 head he raises to sell in the local market; he also raises barnyard fowl and has more than 7 years’ experience managing his business.  He’s able to cover his and his family’s expenses with the income he earns.

Juan wants to accelerate his livestock’s growth which is why he wants to buy nutritionally balanced feed for the sheep as well as for his barnyard fowl; he will also make improvements to the corral so he can sell them for a better price thus attaining improved quality of life.  This is why he thinks it’s a good idea to ask Edpyme Alternativa for a 1,000 new sol loan.

loans.use: to buy animal feed.

loans.name: Walter

texts.es:
Walter tiene 32 años, tiene 2 hijos en edad escolar, vive con su familia en el distrito de Zaña, ubicado a 1 hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace 3 años a la crianza de borregos, aves de corral y ganado vacuno, los cuales engorda y cuando ya han alcanzado su peso y tamaño ideal los vende a los comerciantes de la zona.  Con los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad cubre sus gastos y los de su familia.

Walter desea mejorar la alimentación de sus animales para que estos se desarrollen de mejor manera y pueda venderlos a un mejor precio, por este motivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 3000 nuevos soles con lo que comprará alimento balanceado para su ganado.
texts.en: Walter, 32, has two school age children; he lives with his family in Zaña District located an hour away from the city of Chiclayo.  He’s been raising sheep, barnyard fowl and cattle for the last three years.  He fattens them up and once they reach ideal size and weight he sells them to local merchants.  With income from this activity he’s able to cover his and his family’s expenses.  Walter wants to improve his animals’ nutrition so that they will develop better and can be sold for a better price which is why he needs to ask Edpyme Alternativa for a 3,000 new sol loan to buy nutritionally balanced animal feed.

loans.use: to buy animal feed.

loans.name: Edmer

texts.en:
Edmer is a 32-year-old fisherman from Getafe, Bohol, Philippines. He has four young children. Edmer is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets, and to pay for the school fees of his children. He believes that this loan could be a great help for the success of his fishing business.

Edmer hopes to save money in the future, for the schooling of his children.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets and to pay for the school fees of his children

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua is married and has 3 children. Ekua sells fante kenkey (similar to sourdough dumplings) at Aburasa near Elmina.  She has been doing this for 4 years. Her husband is a farmer.  Ekua uses her income to help her husband in the general up-keep of their home.  Ekua will use the loan to purchase bags of maize to produce her kenkey to sell.  With the new profits from her business, Ekua plans to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase bags of maize to produce her kenkey to sell.

loans.name: Esi

texts.en:
Esi is a widow and has six children. She sells gari in Aburasa, near Elmina. Gari is a staple food made out of cassava that she has sold for 10 years.

Esi uses her income to feed, clothe, and pay for school fees for her children. Esi will use the loan to purchase bags of gari to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Esi plans to produce her own gari to sell.

loans.use: purchase bags of gari to sell.

loans.name: Kwaku

texts.en: Kwaku  is married  and has two children. Kwaku sells coconuts at Aburasa, near Elmina, which he has done for the past eight years. His wife is a petty trader. Kwaku uses his income to pay his children's school fees. Kwaku will use the loan to purchase more coconuts to sell. With the new profits, Kwaku plans to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase more coconuts to sell

loans.name: Nana Yaa

texts.en: Nana Yaa sells banku (fermented maize dough) at Aburasa near Elmina. She is married and has 3 children. Her husband is a laborer at Gacem.  Nana Yaa has been selling banku for 2 years. She uses her income to support her husband's income in the general upkeep of their home. Her loan will be used to buy bags of maize to produce her kenkey (Ghanaian food similar to a dumpling or tamale) to sell. She hopes to use the new profit to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy bags of maize to produce her kenkey to sell

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
For the past seven years, Joseph has been selling fresh fruits with a monthly income of KES 13,900. He is married to Carol who is a business lady and they do not have any children.

Joseph is applying for his first loan term with KADET LTD after being introduced by a staff member.  He will use the loan to buy more fresh pineapples for sale. 

With the anticipated profit from the business he plans to expand the business. His hopes and dreams are to be a leading distributor of fresh fruits in Thika town.

loans.use: To buy more fresh pineapples to sell.

loans.name: Erika

texts.es:
Erika tiene 28 años de edad, tiene 1 hijo y vive con su esposo e hijo en el distrito de Oyotún, una zona agrícola situada aproximadamente a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Al igual que la mayoría de mujeres de la zona, se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales para ayudarse a percibir ingresos, ella cría animales menores en la parte posterior de su domicilio, cuando estas ya ha alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo las ofrece en venta a los negociantes que siempre visitan el lugar en donde vive.

Erika desea mejorar la alimentación de los animales que cría para percibir mayores ingresos y también desea realizar algunas mejoras en su hogar, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Erika es una mujer bastante conocida en la zona, sus vecinos le consideran una mujer honrada y confiable.
texts.en:
Erika, 28, has a son; she lives with her husband and son in Oyotún District, an agricultural zone located two hours from the city of Chiclayo.  Like most women in the zone, she works raising and selling animals to earn income.  She raises small animals in her back yard and when they reach a good level of development she sell them to merchants who always come by the area where she lives.

Erika wants to improve the nutrition of the animals she raises to that she can earn higher income and she also wants to do some home improvements which is why she thinks it’s a good idea to request her first loan from Edpyme Alternativa, 1,000 new soles that will help her reach her objective.  Erika is quite well-known in the zone and her neighbors consider her to be honest and trustworthy.

loans.use: to buy animal feed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase another heifer to rear for dairy farming.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace sells soap and other detergents at Aburasa, near Elmina. She is married and has one child. Her husband is a petty trader. Grace has been selling soap since three years ago. She is responsible for assisting her husband in the general up-keep of their home. Her loan will be used to buy boxes of soap and powdered soap to resell. She hopes to use the new profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy boxes of soap and powdered soap to resell

loans.name: Mina

texts.en: Mina is married and has 7 children.  She sells footwear in Aburasa, which she has done for 3 years. Mina uses her income to support her husband's income in the general upkeep of their home. She will use the loan to purchase footwear. With the new profits from her expanded business, Mina plans to invest.

loans.use: to purchase footwear to sell.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua is married and has 4 children. She sells footwear in the town of Aburasa, near Elmina. She has sold footwear for 6 years. Her husband is a tailor. Ekua uses her income to assist her husband in paying their utility and housing bills.  Ekua will use the loan to purchase more footwear to sell. With the new profits, Ekua plans to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more footwear to sell.

loans.name: Edwina

texts.en:
Edwina is 28 year old married woman with 3 young children. She is engaged in a fishing business with her husband. Edwina sells her husband's catch at the market.
 
She wants to expand their fishing business but lacks the financial resources to do so. She has requested a loan to buy fishing materials such as fish nets and lead weights. Edwina hopes that this loan will help increase their daily catch and income. She wants to save money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials such as fish nets and lead weights
